38715452.review:
When I finally got the last achievement for this game and ALT F4'd out, it said it took me 26 hours, but with all the time I've spent doing other things with this game just running in the background, I'd say it took me around 20 hours total to get every achievement.

I have quite a bit to say about the game experience I had.
I discovered Kingdom Rush not too long ago, and enjoyed it. I was quite excited for this game as a continuation.
To make it a bit easier to digest, I'll make a pros and cons list.

+PROS:
+The new hero level-up system is great. Rather than having to level your hero from level 1 on each map, it's cumulative.
+Better towers that all feel viable.
+The addition of small comic strips before or after some maps.
+Some of the maps feel more alive. Sandpeople from star wars shooting random targets, giant plants that eat whoever gets too close to them, erupting volcanoes that force you to move your guys so they don't get killed. Those kind of things.
+They toned slightly down on pop culture references that their last game was too packed with.
+More achievements than the previous game, although some of these are a little grindy.

-CONS
-For a game with so few voicelines, its sad that they use so much from their previous game. 
-Lots of reused sound effects, visuals and sprites.
-It feels like most of the creativity with enemies and maps was spent in the early levels and then just dropped later.
-Most enemies are just reskins of eachother without having anything special about them.
-Besides what I mentioned in the PROS section, they didn't really do anything new with the game.
-One achievement is to have a templar survive fatal damage 5 times in a row. This is calculated to about a 7% chance. Having a 7% chance to get an achievement is not fun.

With that out of the way, I want to add that this is a FREE mobile game. I think in the mobile version you have to use gems to buy new heroes, and these gems can be earned or bought for money. While in the steam version, you get all heroes for free when you clear maps. I was perfectly fine with this when I played the first game, cause everything was new and exciting. But now that they have recycled so many designs, sounds, visuals and voicelines while at the same time hardly did anything to change up the game, I can't really say it's worth the money.
I bought it on a 50% sale and even that feels like too much.

Don't get me wrong, I liked the original game and I like this game aswell. It's a good tower defense with cartoony looks and addictive gameplay. I just wish it was evolved a bit further.

37959679.review:
There's a lot of bad sequels out there - really bad ones - but this is not one of them. It seems that Ironhide Studios are free of the curse of the sequels, as they have managed to recreate and improve upon the magic of the first game in this amazing Tower Defense followup. It has a main campaign, two mini-campaigns after you beat the main one and a singular expert-level with its own boss. It has better balancing, more imaginative towers, bosses and enemies, as well as a more interesting story. Also, just like the original, once you've completed each level up to three stars, you unlock the Iron and Heroic challenges to test your skills against elite waves, or one mega wave in the case of Iron. It is quite frankly the best Tower Defense game I have ever played.

(Improvements are how much better each percentage is than in the original)

Graphics - 74% (Improvement of 2%)
Music - 80% (Improvement of 3%)
Gameplay - 87% (Improvement of 4%)
Story - 59% - (Great improvement of 16%)
Difficulty Balancing - 87% (Amazing improvement of 30% [Also, the original was rated on balancing as well])
Enjoyment Factor - 90% (Improvement of 3%)

Overalll - 79.5% (Improvement of 9.67%)

给新手的几个建议:
1.先无脑升满支援兵，一有就放
2.英雄选择有坦度的
3.防御塔类型一定要均匀（迫击炮在大部分情况不用太多）
4.迫击炮尽量放在多路兼顾的地方
5.士兵集结在塔多的地方，很多情况最好放在交叉路口
6.有漏网之鱼先用支援兵堵上，马上用英雄过去打

Interesting sequel for the first game. While most of the game reuses content from the first one, there's a few new additions that make it unique in its own. It has some problems, but it's still a solid game for any tower defense fan.


-------Pros-------

+ Beautiful background art
+ Fantastic soundtrack
+ Several different heroes
+ Several different enemies
+ Well done port from the mobile version
+ Challenging levels
+ Level design allows different tactics
+ Decent story for a TD game

-------Cons-------

- Same powers from the first game
- Boss fights are almost the same
- Stronger enemies could give more gold
- More stars than abilities to spend them
- Some levels are too easy
- Towers too similar to the ones in the first game
- No fast forward makes earlier waves boring
- Soldiers are worthless against ranged enemies
- Can't order towers to attack a specific enemy

36131158.review:
A great tower defense game for all ages!
This game is very good, but also very challenging, especialy when you start doing normal or veteran difficulty. I love tower defense games in general but if i have to list my top 3 this one would be my 2nd spot.

This game has 4 different towers, ok, not much. Each tower then has 3 upgrades and 2 specialist forms with special ability upgrade, now we're talking. Each tower has creative specialist forms like for an archer there's an axe thrower, or a necromancer for one of the mage's form. Each tower has its uses, though more so then others( [strike] archer > bomb in every way possible [/strike] ).

The strategy is VERY in depth. Choose a tower on any location you want and upgrade it however you want though sometimes you won't win. All the star upgrades choices and hero choices can win, though your strategy will have to change depending on them.

I like that all levels are possible if you got good strats and I like that sometimes there are difficulty spikes to keep you in check.

All in all if you like TDs then check this game out, and if you've never tried one i suggest this game as a start to see if you like it.

36095081.review:
Yep!

If you didn't play [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/and_stay_out/recommended/246420]the first game[/url], go do that before buying this.  Don't worry!  It's good too!

This sequel is "more of the same", in a positive way.  Some new tower types, enemy abilities, and map designs will have you thinking in new ways.  For example, Necromancer towers let you raise your foes as undead to act as temporary blockers, and enemy spellcasters can shield their soldiers from damage, requiring focused fire or an antimagic totem to nullify them.  These new wrinkles keep the old formula fresh.

There are more Heroes to work with this time around, and "levelling up" is now permanent, instead of only lasting for a single map.  Some like this change, some don't.  I do; it gave me a little bit of extra leverage when retrying a tough map with a slightly stronger Hero than before, but it never led to steamrolling.  Some players will choose one or two favorite Heroes and stick with them; I rotated through the whole roster, and by the time I finished the last map on Iron difficulty, everyone was at maximum level.  Satisfying.

The original game was very punishing on the final expansion levels; [i]Frontiers[/i] eases off a bit.  It's still hard at the end, but never seems to require "one true configuration" of towers as its predecessor did.  The previous game was a bit more hard core than I liked - once I was able to 1-star the last level on normal difficulty, I called it good.  Here, I was ultimately able to max score every level on every difficulty, and enjoyed myself the entire time.

Bottom line, this is another outstanding entry in the tower defense genre.  Enjoy!

35789575.review:
Personal Rating: 9 of 10

Kingdom Rush series again managed to deliver a solid Tower Defense game. If you are itching for a casual and dynamic tower defense game look no further. This comic-esque game is similar to the predecessor with quirky dialogue and paid its tribute to some of the biggest games and movies titles in history such as Mortal Kombat, Indiana Jones and etc is guarantee to bring back some memories.

The gameplay and towers upgrade structure is the same as the previous title but a whole new tower specialty upgrade. There are no single way to win a level. DIfficulty is scalable and does not affect yours unlockables or stars earned. There are also no pesky leveling or tower upgrading outside level.

Heroes, however now has persistent level meaning experience and levels gained are permanent. Heroes are free to choose from once they are unlocked (by progressing in game). Levels can be challenging but also rather forgiving. There are many enemies type and the levels are spanned across several theme each with its own traits and strategy. 

The length of the game is simply enough to keep things interesting without getting too grindy or repetitive. For achievements chasers, don;t be put off by the long list. Once you've completed the game entirely, surely most of them have been unlocked so put no mind to them when playing. Game is balanced and levels can be short enough to pick up a game or 2 casually if you won't want to sink too many hours at one go.

35568495.review: KR:F is primarily a tower defense game, but one where you also control one (or sometimes 2) heroes that can move about the play area. The heroes add an interesting twist to the TD game because it's not just about placing and upgrading towers, especially since some of the heroes' abilities can enhance tower's stats. There are about 16 heroes that you can unlock as you progress through the game, and they are all varied and interesting. Some heroes can fly, for instance, while others can burrow underground or teleport. Some heroes can buff towers, while others do massive area damage when they die. Choosing the right hero for a stage can be the difference between winning and losing, and sometimes I found I needed to try the stage a number of times with different strategies while levelling up my heroes to meet the challenge. The graphics and sound are charming with subtle pop-culture references ("it's on like Donkey Kong!").

35506088.review:
Продолжение одного из лучших tower defence'ов всех времен получилось образцово-показательное. Если ты играл в Kingdom Rush и тебе понравилось - заканчивай чтение, бери игру, тебе снова понравится.

Неизменный визуальный стиль может зародить сомнение, что перед нами всего лишь набор карт и полной цены игра стоит не может. Отринь сомненья, нововведений здесь предостаточно. Полностью поменялись специализации башен, а также их свойства и улучшения: все свои старые любимые стратегии ты можешь просто забыть - придется учиться заново.

Стоит выделить три больших изменения по сравнению с оригиналом. Во-первых, огромное внимение уделено баффам и дебаффам, теперь на них можно даже построить всю оборону, а в дополнительных кампаниях они добавят головной боли. Во-вторых, героев теперь не просто много, они кардинально отличаются друг от друга, у каждого 5 прокачиваевых свойств и/или спецприемов, активируемых автоматически. Правильно поставленный герой практически не требует внимания игрока, некоторые сами носятся по всей карте. Однако все уровни рассчитаны на грамотное использование героев и без них труднопроходимы (по крайней мере на 3 звезды). В-третьих, карты окончательно стали мультимаршрутные, особенно это касается дополнительных кампаний. На большинстве из них есть тематические интерактивные элементы: от простой хижины со спецюнитами, до особых негативных эффектов (спойлерить не буду).

Игра все так же под завязку набита, нафарширована отсылками к поп-культуре, в основном к фильмам, в очень широких временных пределах: от весьма старых до совсем новых. Больше всего греет душу «крик Вильгельма». Все персонажи массово овладевают невидаными средствами научно-технического прогресса дварфского или просто «неизвестного происхождения». Того и гляди, в какой-нибудь следующей части в космос полетят. Впрочем, авторам не отказывает чувство меры и стиля, все оформлено идеально.

В рамках основной и дополнительных кампаний игра предлагает набор очень непростых задач. И хотя «Героический» и «Железный» режимы после этого проходятся легко и просто, игра способна порадовать и тех кто уже успел освоиться: в наличии режим повышенной сложности. Мир боли и превозмоганий гарантирован.

Итого: изумительное продолжение изумительного tower defenc'а.
Фанатам жанра брать в обязательном порядке.
Всем любителям просто хороших игр - присмотритесь, не пожалеете.

35498529.review:
Ich kenne viele Tower-Defense-Spiele.
"Kingdom Rush Frontiers" ist das beste.

Hübsche, übersichtliche Comic-Grafik.
Abgedrehte Helden.
Komplizierte, aber nie völlig unfaire, Level die immer mal wieder Überraschungen bereit halten.
Auf den Karten sind kleine Gimmicks versteckt.
Die Geräusche, und die sehr seltene Sprachausgabe der Helden, wiederholen sich, sind aber sehr stimmig.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad lässt sich jederzeit verändern.
Es gibt meistens sehr viele Wege zum Ziel. Die verschiedenen Turm-Typen lassen sich perfekt kombinieren.

Der Vorgänger "Kingdom Rush" war mein bisheriger Tower-Defense-Favorit, abgelöst von diesem Nachfolger.
Wer sich den maximalen Spielspass gönnen will spielt erst den Vorgänger und dann diesen Teil.

35397873.review:
[h1] Kingdom Rush Frontiers, much like its predecessor, is a fantastic tower defense game with entertaining light strategy gameplay, excellent hero, enemy and level variety and a vivid artstyle. Weaknesses such as very repetitive gameplay on the veteran difficulty, coupled with the lack of a fast forward button, bland story & soundtrack hint at its mobile origin and impact the fun negatively. But overall, you will get many hours of captivating light strategy gameplay. [/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
+ 22 levels lead to multiple double digit hours of  entertaining gameplay
+ stellar enemy variety, myriad of different and unique enemies
+ fantastic, colorful and vivid artstyle
+ very impactful upgrade variety for the final stages of towers
+ enormous variety with 16 heroes to choose from
+ challenging enough on the highest difficulty
+ great optimization, runs well on low-end systems where similar games come to a crawl

[b]Contra:[/b]
- each hero has to be leveled up individually, making the game very grindy later on
- gameplay is not possible to be sped up, making finding the perfect strategy extremely tiresome
- there's some randomness involved, especially with the hero skills, making later levels on veteran very frustrating
- unimpressive and repetitive soundtrack
- bland and forgettable story

35222716.review:
最初接触到这款游戏是在4399上的小游戏，被其精美的画风和优秀的塔防玩法给吸引住了。游戏流程不长，早早就通了关。其后网页版的更新到1.13版本后再也没有更新了，而我也在这时候再也没有接触过这款游戏了。
时光飞逝，等我在接触这款游戏的时候是在steam上无意中找到的。看着这个老朋友，我等不及打折就入了手。
相比于网页版那简陋的地图，steam版地图做得尤为精美：与一代相衔接，细节丰富，体现了每一关的特色。内容上也比网页版多出了在手机端上才有的海怪，墓地，蜥蜴人关卡。英雄也是很良心的包含手机版的全部英雄。关卡不同难度的挑战让新手玩家和高玩尽情能享受游戏的乐趣。游戏随后更新的中文更是令这游戏在我心中加分不少。
为了纪念这款游戏，我把全部难度重新通了一遍，英雄全部满级。就算全难度通关，但这游戏依然让我爱不释手。
只可惜下一作皇城突袭：起源的steam版不知道要等多久才能出。

35039266.review: I don't know if people complained that the first one was too easy for them, or if I'm just somehow good at the first game and awful at the second, because I found the first game to be a fun challenge, while the second's difficulty was too high for me to really enjoy. Also, the larger number of heroes with individual leveling needed per hero seems a bit more annoying in this game than how the leveling of heroes and the number of them worked in the first game. The overall difficulty, however, is what really put me off here, because I felt like it was perfect in the first game, but excessive this time around. If you wanted a harder Kingdom Rush, this game is for you, but if the first one felt just right, this one might be a disappointment for you, as it was for me.

35029510.review:
This is the second instalment in the Kingdom Rush series. For those who would like a breakdown of the gameplay, you can read my [url=store.steampowered.com/recommended/recommendgame/246420] review[/url] for the first game as gameplay is nearly identical. The biggest change made is that the heroes - of which there are 16 - don't start as level 1 at the start of each mission, but now accumulate XP between missions. The level cap is still 10.

This is a great tower defense game with beautiful art, responsive controls and level design that provides a challenge for most. The story at the start of each mission is not so engaging and as I was grinding for the last achievements I rather missed a fast forward button. These are minor gripes; I have no problem recommending this to all interested in tower defense games.

34985008.review:
This is a good game.  It is a LOT harder than the original version.  The new towers aren't as overpowered as the last one, and the AoE effects are heavily reduced.  This makes a good sequel to the original as a result because it is far more of a challenge.

Also the hero system is completely revamped.  Heroes now permanently level up.  It has these benefits:

1.  If you lose a level and can't figure it out your hero will still level up and become stronger in the next.
2.  More replay value.  It gives those "completetionists" more to strive for.

The enemies in this game are far more varied in ability, and you definitely want to read the encyclopedia if you lose a level multiple times.  Going for balance can be a big problem, and specializing the different lanes will help.

34802181.review: Se você jogou Kingdom Rush, vai notar que este é bastante semelhante em mecânicas. Porém são fases, unidades e inimigos diferentes. Para quem não conhece, assim como o primeiro jogo, Frontiers é um tower defense em que você deve espalhar por vagas no cenário torres para atacar os inimigos que estão vindo. O objetivo é não deixá-los sair do cenário. Quanto melhor você defende, mais estrelas você ganha para trocar por upgrades. Ainda é possível fazer alguns desafios em cada fase para ganhar mais estrelas. Também é possível utilizar heróis a sua escolha em quase todos os mapas. Se você gosta desse gênero, mesmo não tendo jogado o primeiro, pode jogar este que é muito bom também.

1. The game is quite long, and has some good replayability, making it the perfect time waster

3. This game and the original Kingdom Rush have the same price, 10$, and they occasinally go on sale from time to time, so if you see a sale, dont miss dat chance.
4. The amount of enemies this game has is quite impressive, almost every stage has a new enemy appearing atleast somewhere, some more rare then others, and, although it has less bosses then the original Kingdom Rush, they are still a challenge to fight and will keep you on your toes.
So, theres the good things, but there is one flaw in this game that may not be that big of a issue to some, but it kinda is to me
The difficulty is quite hard, even on Casual mode, but atleast its not as hard as Normal or Veteran mode, those are almost impossible to do without lossing a hefty amount of lives.
But, overall, i recommend this game to anyone looking for a great tower defense game, this is truley the best you can get.

34192421.review:
This game is an improvement over the original [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/tablis/recommended/246420/]Kingdom Rush[/url] - which was already great. The towers are all new (at least the advanced onces), fun to use and also seem better thought out. The overpowered lightning tower is gone, but there is even crazier stuff available now. Where the tower design in the first game was somewhat cautious, standard fare for TD games, here the developers let loose their imaginations and it works out. I also appreciate that many towers now have animations showing which upgrades were purchased. 

There is a wide array of heroes to choose from and this time progress (leveling) is persistent! There are more map-related elements now like unique towers, heroes that appear only for one map, environmental hazards and so on. Another nice touch is that you don't need perfect performance to get 3-star ratings - it's possible to let a few enemies past and still get the top grade. Once again though, you run out of upgrades to purchase halfway through the game and then you're just collecting stars for no real reason. The story is... kinda lacking, but then who plays a TD game for the story? Not me.

34107556.review:
Fantastic game.  Everything I wrote about the original (down below) applies here, but with new levels, heros and units to provide additional challenge.  More of a good thing in this game. 

Original Kingdom Rush Review

Probably the best Tower Defence game I have played.  Don't let my steam hours fool you, I have a whole lot more on my tablet, where I originally played this.  Very addictive gameplay.  

Each level have a set amount of points you can build towers on and you can choose to build one of 4 towers.  The basic towers are  

Barracks provide troops that do damage but also engage mobs, preventing them from advancing down the late. 
Archer Towers provides ranged dps, high rof but low damage, good for weak swarm mobs and magick resistant mobs. 
Wizard tower provides ranged dps, low rof but high damage, good for armored enemies and slow enemies. 
Artillery towers fire explosive rounds that do aoe splash damage, great for swarm mobs.  

Now each of these towers can be upgraded multiple times and each have two unique upgrade paths.  Once fully upgrades they will have 3 additional bonus you can purchase with 3 levels each.  They have this for each unique upgrade path provide plenty of variety in your tactics.  

In addition to your towers you have a hero that you can upgrade throughout the game (all heros are available on PC verssion).  Heros are powerful units that can help hold the line against the unrelenting tide.  You also have troops (seperate from baracks) you can spawn at any location on the map.  These can be ugpraded throughout the game as well.    They are great to deploy to help hold the line or as a last ditch effort to stop a mob from hitting your base. 

Each level has 3 version.  You have the standard campaign level, then you have two more difficult versions.  These prevent you from using certain skills or towers and are tough but a great challenge and give good XP rewards which you can use to upgrade your towers (these ugprades are passive abilities).  

The two main differences I remember from PC version and Tablet version is you cannot purchase buffs on PC version and all heros are unlocked.  On tablet most heros need to be purchased with real money. 

Highly Recommended.

34063822.review:
Продолжение лучшей, на мой взгляд, современной игры в жанре Tower Defence.

+ Геймплей.
Суть осталась, как и в предыдущей части. Но изменились специализации башен, поэтому играть надо по другому, нежели раньше. Геймплей остался такой же проработанный. Куча враждебных юнитов и боссов не дадут заскучать. Количество героев тоже радует (и они на любой вкус). Карты очень хорошо проработаны в плане геймплея. В общем, играется всё так же интересно, как и в предыдущей части.

+ Сюжет.
Для своего жанра сюжет неплох, хотя и банален. Больше радует наличие отличного юмора и некоторых отсылок, коих тоже предостаточно.

+ Графика.
Всё такая же сочная, красивая, стильная, фэнтезийная и в какой-то мере даже милая. Игра визуально проработана не хуже, чем технически. Разные локации проработаны по-разному, но одинаково качественно. Смотреть на такую картинку — одно удовольствие.

+ Атмосфера.
Вышел отличный фэнтезийный мир. На это указывают герои, юниты, фразы и даже визуальная часть. Все аспекты игры гармонично сочетаются и получается неплохая фэнтезийная вселенная.

+ Оптимизация.
Во время прохождения мною не было замечено ни лагов, ни багов, ни вылетов, ни чего либо ещё. Всё изумительно работает.

+ Звук.
Отличный саундтрек, своеобразная неплохая озвучка и хорошие звуки окружения. Не к чему придраться.

Продолжение вышло на уровне первой части и играется соответствующе. Смело рекомендую всем ценителям жанра Tower Defence.

Геймплей: 10/10
Сюжет: 10/10
Графика: 10/10 
Атмосфера: 10/10
Оптимизация: 10/10
Звук: 10/10

10/10

33821266.review:
Personally, Frontiers has many improved aspects over the first titme of the Kingdom Rush series. To name a few: the hero level-up system the five skills, the tower types and bonuses which require lots of synergy and real tactics to be efficient... etc...
The longevity is also in my opinion higher, for the player who is not the typical expert looking for a worthy challenge. This longevity is mainly given by the fact that it is interesting to tinker with the heroes and how they progress and improve as they level up.

The story is the usual revisited quest to defeat an evil lich/demon, whatever, but the variety and originality of the enemies and the towers is more impressive than the first game, in my opinion. 

Overall I'm extremely satisfied of the purchase, although the price should be set at 5 euros in my opinion. I advise thus o buy during the Steam sales.

33562048.review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
+ great art style
+ awesome tower defense elements
+ cool puzzles/levels
+ fun achievements
+ level specific events
+ Heroic & Iron mode level variant
+ 16 heroes to choose from
+ 22 levels (66 with Heroic & Iron mode)

[b]CONS:[/b]
- Kingdom Rush Origins is not on Steam
- some people will find it too easy compared to Kingdom Rush
- not all heroes are useful in the more difficult stages
- makes you angry when that last minion ruins your perfect score

[b]Comment:[/b]
After playing and really enjoying Kingdom Rush I was happy that the sequel appeared here on Steam. This game is possibly easier than Kingdom Rush as less of a specific mix is needed. Towers often have special variants that make them eventually viable for almost any enemy. This is the trade-off so you can play the way you want. Three expansion unlock after finishing the main campaign, each adds new units to make the gameplay fresh and a bit more difficult. You have a lot of heroes to choose from but apart from maybe the expansions there is no real reason to level them up. You can just pick the one you like and get him to maximum level and just keep using him/her. Though I have to say not all of them are usable in the later levels, especially the expansions. I had an occasional game freeze (FPS drop) when a tower is built or hero revives but it happened only on some levels and not always. During the campaign most of the stages have a special event (sand worm, ship cannons, etc.) that makes the gameplay more dynamic as you have to adjust to event while fighting enemies. Overall a really great sequel and definitely a game to check out if you are into tower defense games!

[b]P.S.:[/b] Great Defender, Heroic Defender & Iron Defender probably only unlock in Normal or Hard difficulty (this was the case in the first game), but you only need to finish the first 15 levels to unlock them

33426413.review:
Bardzo klasyczna gra w "obronę wieży". Skończyłem poprzednią część, przy której świetnie się bawiłem. Podobne wrażenia tutaj, ale po kolei:

ZA:
+ prosta, ale bardzo ładna, wręcz urocza i "funkcjonalna" grafika
+ proste i nieudziwnione zasady Tower Defense'a
+ niezłe możliwości rozwoju bohaterów, wieżyczek etc.
+ dużo bohaterów i ich fajne "super-moce"
+ dużo mapek do pogrania
+ dużo różnych złośliwców do pokonania
+ generalnie: nieźle rozbudowana gra na długie godziny
+ bardzo rozsądnie ustawiony poziom trudności (np. Normal jest... odrobinkę trudny, ale do przejścia, jak na razie...)
+ sporo zabawnych odniesień do pop-kultury, zwłaszcza do filmów, do odkrycia (np. Star War, Conan, Aliens...)
+ super się gra na ekranie dotykowym np. na tablecie; gra jest wręcz do tego stworzona

PRZECIW:
- ...aczkolwiek na urządzeniach przenośnych program niekiedy płata figle (rozdzielczność, spowalnianie programu etc.)
- odgłosów w grze mam dosyć po pół godzinie, chociaż są i wyjątki, np. Cronan ;) mówiący głosem podobnym do Schwartzennegera
- obleśna grafika w głównym Menu

Werdykt:
Dla fanów Tower Defens'ów - brać i grać. Gra jest spora, fajnie rozbudowana, grywalna, zabawne etc. Kupiłbym jeszcze raz.

33418915.review:
Неплохое продолжение одной из лучших современных TD-серий. Но первой части всё же по многим параметрам проигрывает. Баланс, сложность и тактические возможности в первой Kingdom Rush были на уровень выше - да и враги с боссами поинтереснее. Тут же одни башни и герои явно лучше других: прокачал костяного дракона, понаставил ворующих золото ассасинов - и никаких проблем. Гуглить работающее положение башен и порядок их постройки я ни разу не полез даже при прохождении "железных" и "крылатых" уровней. В целом -
 приятная игрушка  на позалипать с симпатичной графикой, приличным звуком и множеством отсылок к поп-культуре. Ачивки, кстати, очень легкие, любителям понабивать идеальные игры стоит однозначно присмотреться.

33148517.review:
Ein absolutes Muss für Tower-Defense-Freunde. Ich hatte 2012 den Vorgänger ("Kingdom Rush") im Browser gespielt und damals schon jede Menge Spaß. Der Nachfolger setzt noch einen drauf und fügt mit den Helden ein sehr cooles Feature hinzu.

Positiv:

+ Suchterzeugendes Tower-Defense Spielprinzip.
+ Sinnvole Anzahl an Türmen, nicht zu viele, nicht zu wenige.
+ Meistens führen mehrere Strategien zum Ziel.
+ Zusätzliche taktische Komponente durch zahlreiche Helden mit den unterschiedlichsten Spezial-Fertigkeiten.  
+ Liebevoll gestaltete Level, auf denen es (wie in einem Wimmelbuch) immer etwas zu entdecken gibt und die häufig gameplay-relevante Eigenschaften besitzen.
+ Nett aufgemachte Grafik im Comic-Stil
+ Sehr humorvoll, unzählige Pop-Culture-Referenzen und Veralberungen.
+ Ideal für Zwischendurch, ein Level kann in 10 - 20 Minuten abgeschlossen werden.
+ Solider Umfang (ca. 15 Stunden, wenn man alles sehen und abschließen will ca. 25 - 30 Stunden).

Negativ:

- Level auf der Stufe "Heroic" und "Iron" zu einfach, meist einfacher als auf der Story-Stufe.
- Fehlendes Endlos-Level. Darauf hätte ich noch Lust gehabt.

33092395.review:
Если рассудок и жизнь дороги вам, держитесь подальше от [strike]торфяных болот[/strike] серии Kingdom Rush. Нет, мне искренне нравится и оригинальная игра, и Frontiers, но и поиграть на нервах эти представители жанра tower defence тоже умеют.

Начну с хорошего. Меня очень радует, как выглядит игра. Я встречал среди отрицательных отзывов мнения, что все слишком простецки сделано. Да, это не новое слово в области графики, но картинка в игре очень милая и стильная. Для меня это гораздо важнее всего остального. Игровая механика тоже на уровне. В Kingdom Rush Frontiers хватает разнообразия и простор для тактики присутствует. 

А теперь перейду к главному. Доступно три уровня сложности, но по сути это высокая сложность, очень высокая сложность и очень-очень высокая сложность. Нельзя сказать, что это какой-то однозначный минус, но все-таки это особенность, про которую стоит сказать в обзоре.

Безусловно, я рекомендую эту игру. Потому что стоит признать, что игра сложная, но при этом сбалансированная. И если грамотно комбинировать те возможности, которые даются игроку, то успех придет. Просто нужно быть готовым к тому, что проходить все уровни на три из трех звезд с первой попытки будет проблематично даже на самой низкой сложности.

32988137.review:
J'ai acheté ce jeu suite aux soldes steam et au prix de 5€ Kingdom Rush Frontier est vraiment un bon tower defense (Peut-être un peu cher pour son tarif de base).

Sympathique à jouer il offre un bon niveau de difficulté et vous vous retrouverez à réessayer encore et encore différentes combinaisons pour avoir toutes les étoiles de chaque niveau.
La direction artistique est plutôt agréable, les héros sont nombreux et variés, le bestiaire bien fourni et un arbre d'évolution des tours et héros assez conséquent.
Je regrette toute fois l'absence de certains éléments comme le choix de la vitesse du jeu (pas de x2 x4), les capacités spéciales uniquement au nombre de 2 et enfin une tour ou deux en plus n'aurait pas été de trop pour varier encore plus le plaisir.

En gros, si vous aimez les Towers Defense vous pouvez vous y essayer ! Encore plus s'il est en solde.

想到前期为了让怪的来的慢一点
立马开技能派2个民兵去拉仇恨

A great sequel to the legendary Kingdom Rush. Major improvements have been made to the level design and hero customization.

While in the original KR only a few towers seemed actually useful, in Frontiers you can really play around various mechanics. On the other hand, there are fewer boss fights and the overall difficulty feels lower.

It took me approximately 20 hours to complete all the stages and extra modes. I still feel tempted to play, since I want to level up all the heroes and experiment with different setups. It's a shame there is no endless mode like in the mobile app. On the other hand, you get all the heroes without paying for them via microtransactions.

While the game probably won't last you over hundred of hours, it offers a great portion of fun for a very reasonable price.

32238562.review:
So, here we are! Kingdom Rush, the Great and Magnificent, had a sequel, and that's good news. Or is it?

Pros:
+ Kingdom Rush is a hell of a Tower Defense. This sequel is no different.
+ Graphics, little details, Easter Eggs: the charm of the first Kingdom Rush has not lost any magic in this new Frontiers Lands.
+ A very good diversity of enemies with some new interesting mechanics (temporary stealth, teleportation...)
+ Eight new four-tier specialized towers.
+ Some missions offer still more towers (Frankenstein tower, Dwarf bastion...).
+ A very decent amount of content.
+ Much better mechanics for leveling up heroes.

Cons:
- This is not a sequel; more like a stand-alone expansion. 
- Same two magic powers as the original Kingdom Rush.
- Many new enemies are just reskins from the first episode.
- Some foes are very trick to beat (Sniper lizards, Mage tortoise)
- One tower specialty seems to be useful (to the point of being mandatory) only in one arc of the main campaign. 
- Many issues of the first episode have not been addressed (no fast-forward option, half of the stars just pile up with no use)

Verdict: Is it worthwhile? Of course it is! Aren't we speaking of Kingdom Rush? Have the developers been lazy? Wouldn't say so: the content is still of top-notch quality and the game mechanics worked so well anyway that it would have been pointless to change them.

31392804.review:
[b]You might like if:[/b] You loved the original Kingdom Rush and want more!

Very much what you want from sequel... everything that made the original game great, but with enough new content to keep it fresh and exciting. A completely new set of new enemies, new heroes and 22 new levels... more than you can shake an oversized Dwarven bombard at (or at least enough to shut you up for a good 20-30 hours).

The Tier 4 towers have also undergone an overhaul, providing a new set of tactics and toys to play with; from assassins, to battle mechs... and, most deliciously, a freaking [i]Necromancer Tower[/i]. Finally... Now [i]you're[/i] the one who gets to summon armies of the undead! The new towers feel well-balanced and have a diverse range of special abilities that seem to promote a much stronger focus on synergy than before, at least from my experience (though the Necromancer can feel a little overpowered on lower difficulties).

The only major change (which is hard to say if better/worse) is that the heroes now retain their exp between levels. Where, previously, they'd go from 1-10 in a single level - you now level them up throughout the game, adding earned points into to cool abilities and passive upgrades. Whilst it adds a nice RPG element to your favourite heroes... it can equally add a grind factor if you wish to play with the full range on offer, as you'll need to level them up individually. And obviously, if you wish to try any new heroes, you'll need to level [i]them[/i] up to the same as your current ones to be able to provide a meaningful comparison. So swings and roundabouts really... But the hero you use is more for your own fun, so it's not like you're hindered from finishing the game if you only wanted to stick with a handful or even just the one - in which case this isn't a problem at all.

Other than that: Same loving attention, same cracking array of challenges and same humour... What's not to love? And at 60 fps, it looks smoother than ever before.

31285552.review:
Manteve a qualidade da franquia como um dos melhores tower defenses já feitos, sendo muito recomendável. Não tem muito o que dizer, já que o gênero, por si só, é auto-explicativo. Então, deixarei algumas críticas construtivas e sugestões:

- Gente, precisamos falar sobre revisão de texto e tradução. Sério. Eu consigo achar erro em tudo que eu vejo, até quando não procuro (até no f ucking jogão do(s) ano(s) The Witcher 3 já achei). São erros tipográficos ou tradução errônea. Ninguém tá fazendo de graça, né, então não custa fazer direito. E, apesar dos nomes originais não ajudarem, a tradução pt-br tá muito ao pé da letra e em alguns casos, nada a ver. E olha que eu joguei em espanhol e xeretei em francês, e vi que adaptaram os nomes dos inimigos, em alguns casos.

Exemplos:
sand wraith (en) = desespectro (pt-br) = momia de las arenas (es)
broodguard (en) = guardaninho (what...pt-br) = guardian (es)
blazefang (en) = dentechamas (pt-br) = devastador (es)

"invoking his godly fury all enemies receives 65% extra damage for 5 seconds" (en) = "invocando sua fúria divina todos os inimigos causam 65% mais dano por 5s." (*sigh*...pt-br)

Pode parecer uma coisa banal, mas tem gente recebendo para fazer essas coisas

- IA dos nossos soldados. Eu juro que teve partidas que perdia estrela porque os inimigos passavam literalmente do lado desses animais, trocavam bom dia, e eles não atacavam. Não tinha como dizer que não estava no alcance, haha.
===============================================
- Achievements:

Acho que seria bacana se houvesse algum indicador do quanto estamos próximos de se obter algum achievement. Por exemplo, roubar 10000 de ouro com os assassinos ou matar 100 com os templários. Eu não faço ideia de quantas partidas terei que jogar pra pegar isso. Derrotar 500 com os mechas eu consegui em 2 ou 3! zzz

Os achievements do Iron e Heroic só valem para fases da campanha. Fases bônus não importam. Deveriam.

Outra coisa que pra mim era óbvio ter, seria uma distinção de dificuldade nas conquistas. Não é a mesma coisa você zerar no "casual" (fácil) ou no "veteran" (difícil). Eu gabaritei as estrelas todas no veterano. Algumas encheram o saco, outras me surpreendi de serem bestas, mas fica a ideia aí (se alguém se der ao trabalho de traduzir pro inglês e ler essa birosca rs)...

31099310.review:
首先，作为一个外语没学好的人而言，这游戏有中文很好，但是商店的标注没改，所以前半个月左右发现其实有中文，而且打折，我才买了。
暂时还没通关，先说下暂时的感想，貌似可以改评价的？不管改不改的了，我会不会改，有一点我可以确定，我觉得这游戏值得拥有。
1.游戏貌似不能快进，很多时候前几波初见过不了刷第二遍、第三遍时前几波可以轻松过，但是只能等...每波出怪时间貌似和你打的速度有关，仍然比不过二倍速，作为一个对于运行原理完全不懂的我来说，有个二倍速应该不错（可行性我就不知道了）。
2.一代的所有升级星刚好点完天赋，貌似这版本升级星远远超出天赋，看了下评论好像出了3个DLC，但是没看到商店里写的有DLC，所以大概是免费更新的内容，天赋这方面应该是也没什么好添的了就没有加？天赋好像和一代仅有略微不同。
3.一代我玩的时间比较早了，内容忘的也差不多了，不过感觉这一代内容和一代比几乎完全不一样。
4.有很多英雄，而且可以升级，所以呢，你可以刷满英雄等级再打，但是这种过程就枯燥了，而且因为英雄高等级和低等级输出完全不同，有点降低了游戏的难度和游戏性(个人观点)，其实在10来关这里升级其实也是挺快的，。
5.如果不是强迫症的话，3星评价不是非要一个不漏，18滴血一样3星。
6.至于游戏里的百科全书，感觉意义没那么大，我是没翻出来怎么看防御塔技能的伤害，怪物的介绍还算可以，但貌似还是有不足，比如幽魂，百科全书里写的是无法阻挡，但是事实上游戏内新敌人的提示还有一条：只承受魔法伤害，所以........
7.前排评论说是12个英雄，我查了下现在16个。。。
8.游戏里的升级是可以无限免费洗的，所以可以针对性的出升级，但是因为升级星多了那么多，所以没洗点的乐趣了吧？因为还没通关，所以可能这方面理解有误。
其余的暂时想不到了，以后再说吧。

原来还有二周目。普通难度通关后我又开了个存档发现还有个老兵难度，还没开始玩。

31065843.review:
Klasyczny tower defens. 

W mojej ocenie jeden z najlepszych jaki grałem przez ostatnie 5 lat
Od cześci pierwszej nie różni się innowacjami w mechanice, ta sama formuła.
Natomiast pomysły na nowe wieżyczki i bohaterów są odważniejsze i trochę bardziej rozbudowane.


# Wszyscy przeciwnicy i wieżyczki i bohaterowie są kompletnie nowi w stosunku do części pierwszej
# Dobrze się wraca do gry, świetny klikacz miedzy innymi grami
# Dobry balans trudności
# Jedną plansze trzeba "zmęczyć" kilka żeby ja przejść do końca
# Mnóstwo easteregów z innych gier i filmów! :) 
# Jedna z nielicznych gier które po wymaksowaniu się zaczyna od razu od nowa
# świetna i spójna grafika
# Bohaterów jest sporo i mają liniowy system umiejętności ale w ogólnym odczuciu nie zmieniają drastycznie gry.
# Tą samą grę można przechodzić na kilka sposobów (skupiając się na artylerii, magii albo ostrzale) 
# Do głównego bosa dochodzi się w 10-12godzin później jest jeszcze drugie tyle plansz do pokonania.
# Pierwszą cześć przeszedłem w około 10-15 godzin i spędziłem w niej ponad 90 godzin.
# W tej części można wskrzeszać szkielety i stawiać krasnoludzkie mechy!


Grę polecam w szczególności za jej replayability. Jest coś satysfakcjonującego w rozbryzgiwaniu przeciwników kartaczami.

31062769.review:
[h1]Kingdom Rush Frontiers —— 皇家守卫军：前线[/h1]
更多样、更平衡、更好玩

+画风可爱细节丰富
（塔、单位、背景，可爱简笔但细节很多，非常精致）
+音乐音效语音印象深刻
（特别是Be quick or be dead，Ready to 浪爆~）
+内容丰富
（塔种，英雄，技能，敌人种类都相当丰富，玩家能自由搭配选择玩出各种花样）
+难度适中
（多数关卡金钱充裕，解法多样，整体感觉比前作难一点，对拉怪控兵的需求更多了
但技术性高玩也能找到十足的乐趣，通过操作地面单位拉怪，各种无英雄，单种塔，最少塔，也能玩出花来）
+海量彩蛋
（大多数成就都对应有影视或游戏作品的彩蛋，异形和刺客信条甚至直接做进了游戏主体内容中，引人会心一笑）
+平衡性、新的英雄机制
（各个塔较前作更为平衡，[spoiler]主要没了秒天秒地的特斯拉[/spoiler]，也更提倡塔与塔之间的配合，更加好玩，新的英雄等级机制还有些养成的趣味）

[b]塔防游戏爱好者绝对不能错过的一款好游戏！[/b]
P.S.以前“皇家守卫军”和“王国保卫战”的译名是并存的，我比较喜欢也习惯前者，现在这作官译是后者。。。

30951445.review:
I love playing Tower Defense games and Plants VS Zombies was my favoutite. Then I stumble into Kingdom Rush, the prequel to this and I was mind blown. Kindom Rush Frontiers is way even better! The 2d visuals are very well drawn and so beautiful.
There are more heroes to choose from, different new towers, abilities and new enemies. What piques my interest with this one is how funny the characters are and how they used references from other games to Indiana Jones and the Predator just to name a few. Everything has been made so well and the gameplay is so fluid. The game has achievements based on many other game references hidden pretty well in a level for example "Finding Reptile from Mortal Kombat". This makes me so curious as to what is hidden and got me searching thoroughly throughout a whole single level (and there are tons of levels). The boss fights are also very engaging especially when you're low on money and defenses and your Hero dies. 
Overall a full 10/10 and hats off to "Ironhide Studios" for this very well polished game. I hope there's another one coming.

30932062.review:
Kingdom Rush Frontiers is a fine tower defense game, but its relatively standard gameplay does little to set it apart from its competitors.  If you are looking for a tower defense game to play, I would recommend Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten instead, because it does much of what Kingdom Rush Frontiers tries to do, but better.

Particularly glaring in Kingdom Rush Frontiers is the lack of a fast-forward button, which has become standard in the genre for a reason.  The game has little downtime, but levels can take 15 minutes or more to complete, so replaying them for a better score at 1x speed can be annoying.

The four tower types are unique, but I thought some of the tower specializations were underpowered.  The numerous heroes have a good variety both thematically and gameplay-wise, and were enjoyable to discover.  It would have been nice to be able to more actively control them, because you are given only two spells to affect the battle with in real time.

Kingdom Rush Frontiers has fewer but longer levels than most other tower defense games I've played, but the enemy and map variety keeps things interesting enough.  One highlight was the iron challenges, which disable certain tower types to provide a short but focused challenge.

For the most part, the tooltips are of acceptable quality, though sometimes they refer to having "a chance" of an effect rather than giving numbers.  The metagame is pretty barebones; it mostly consists of upgrading your towers along a linear path.

The story is essentially nonexistent, which I have no problem with.  Don't expect any real characterization or plot developments.

Kingdom Rush Frontiers held my interest, but unfortunately, I see no reason to recommend it over Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten.  I enjoy standard tower defense games, but the sad truth is that if you fail to innovate, you run the risk of someone else making the same game, but better.

30899161.review:
The game is so good, so i have bought it to just write a review. I passed this a long time ago. 

Frontiers is the second game in the Kingdom Rush series.  Actually, when i first time started the game i was pretty dissapointed.  I liked the original KR, but i expected to see something totally new in the second game. For example, new skills, new game modes, etc.. Yeah, Frontiers offers to player new towers, new enemies and new heroes. Also, you have got new map terrains and a new story with comics.. Actually, there are no innovative ideas. Everything is the same. But it is on a proper level. It's like a second season of awesome season one.

I realised that i have got negative feelings because my inflated expectations. After i played some hours i chenged my opinion to extremely posititve. I liked this game. I liked to feel the same feelings which i felt playing the first KR. I am sure now, devs did a right choice keeping

Frontiers is the most easiest game in KR series. I passed all stages on Veteran for 3 stars without any problems. For example, i still have some unpassed levels in KR and Origins. Anyway, i would advice to play original Kingdom Rush before starting Frontiers.

There is nothing really to say about gameplay. If you played KR, you find Frontiers the same game with new towers, enemies and maps. If you didn't, i can say that KR is the best TD game now (I don't consider WC3 maps as a game).

There is no secret that it is a mobile port. But it's really qualitative port. No bugs were found. The game looks good on Full screen. Anyway, i recommend to buy this game on mobile. Not because of the fact that the game is a half cheaper on mobiles, but because it is really awesome what you can play such a great game when you have some free minutes (in a public transport, in a queue, etc).

I recommend this game to play in any platform you prefer.

30875170.review:
Do you crave the nostalgia of those flash tower defense games you played when you were like 7 years old?
Do you want to play a tower defense game that is accually well made with tonnes of content?
Do you like fighting bandits, lizardmen, and zombies with arrows, swords, magic tornados and bombs?
Do you just need something to do for a few hours?

If you said yes to any of these then buy this game, and even if you didn't say yes buy it anyways!

Kingdom Rush Frontiers and the original are awesome games full of epic tower defense action that isn't just "buy a ton of towers = win"

And before your like "hey reviewer dude isn't the flash free" and I say "yes, but this version is better with post campain content, more heroes and FULL SCREEN and all kinds of other stuff." so don't be an idiot and miss out on the full version of Kingdom Rush Frontiers and the original just because its free on flash.

Pros:
-Epic battles
-Easy for a noob yet hard enough for a veteran tower defense player
-Combat that requires you to think which tower will work in each location instead of just buy the tower with the best damage
-Great artstyle
-Heroes now keep their levels
-Little things to do with the map while your towers kick the enemy's behind.
-Funny references in hero voicelines and map easter eggs.
-It's relatively cheap during sales.

Cons:
-The post campain levels are hard, like really hard especially if you want to 3 star them!
-This isn't in your game library.... Yet.

こんにちは。
ブラウザ版のファンで、Android版もやりました。
まだ、全クリアはしてないですが、Andoroidから追加ステージとかはないみたいです。
今回はパソコンでマウス使ってやりたいので、買いました。
1000円なら日曜日を楽しむにはいいんじゃないでしょうか。

あと、課金ヒーローが全員使えます。ヒーロー達はそれぞれ、個性が強いので、ゲームの感じ変わって、けっこう楽しいですよ。
ひとつ、とてもいいなと思ったのが、後半の難易度がいい具合に難しく調整されてると思います。（気のせいかもしれませんが・・・）
昔の恐竜人ステージはイマイチ歯ごたえがなかったですね。今回の彼らは手ごわいです。
日本語訳もファンタジー感のある、いい翻訳です。ストーリーとか、ちょっとしたジョークが分かるのはとても楽しいですね。
ドワアアアプはダイレクトすぎてちょっと笑ったけど。

楽しんでください。

30379929.review:
Again, a great game from Ironhide. 
Again, there is lot of content and the achievements are fair to get (without hardcore grinding). 
Again, good level design and interesting set of enemies and towers (even more diversification than in KR).

In comparison to the first title, I especially enjoyed the importance of choosing the right upgrade for the towers - the tower upgrades play a bigger role in this game.

And the hero leveling system is better than in the first title (You can choose skill upgrades and the level of a hero is not set back to 1 after each level)

So in summary, this is a great game!

Pros
-	Increased difficulty
-	You actually have to think about hero skills
-	You actually have to think about tower upgrades
-	Hero leveling system is more interesting

Cons
-	Still, you “are not forced” to try every hero --> There are a lot of heroes I haven’t used during the game. It’s a pity!
-	A slight one: I did not like the dependency on dedicated special skills during the last level

Again, I’ll sure get the next Ironhide title without questioning once it gets released!

30131762.review:
Don't expect any groundbreaking changes to the series, with this one; Kingdom Rush Frontiers is the first game, again, just with more creative level design. If you're like me, though, that's exactly what you want. If you've finished KR Classic, and you feel like you could use another 21 levels of it, then this game has what you're looking for. 

There are eight new towers, but they replace the eight original towers, so although they're fun to unlock and use, you don't have more towers overall. There are new enemies, but half of them are just reskins of the classics, so only the latter zones really feel noticeably different. Apparently there's also a small improvement to graphics, but I didn't notice.

The only obvious difference, to me, was the introduction of the leveling mechanic for your heroes. This time, they start off at a lower level, and you have to grind them up to lvl 10, and choose which powers to upgrade along the way. Since they all end up the same at lvl 10, however, your individual choices don't really matter in the long run; just grind your favorites to 10, so you can use them on the hard stages. 

Like I said, though... I didn't want anything different, and I don't suspect that you do either. I loved the last game, I wanted more of it, and that is exactly what KR Frontiers delivered. The only complaint I have (without spoilers) is the final boss. I feel like he broke one of the unspoken rules of Tower Defense games, and I did not enjoy fighting him at all.

29711006.review:
Один  из  лучших  представителей  жанра  Защиты  Башнями,  среди  тех  в  которые  я  играл.  Зачастую  так  случается,  что  после  выпуска  отличной  игры,  коей  была  оригинальная  Kingdom  Rush,  продолжение  получается  не  слишком  хорошим,  но  это  не  тот  случай.

Графика  по  большому  счёту  не  изменилась  всё  также  мультяшно  с  большим  вниманием  к  мелочам.  Общая  механика  также  не  испорчена  –  строишь  и  усовершенствуешь  один  из  четырёх  типов  башен  вот  только  все  улучшения  новые.  А  это  значит,  что  маги  теперь  становятся  повелителями  вихрей  или  некромантами,  гномы  создают  огромный  бур  или  механического  робота,  лучники  вооружаются  арбалетами  или  начинают  практиковать  Вуду,  а  из  казарм  выходят  разбойники  или  храмовники.  Не  позабыты  и  герои  –  их  много  на  любой  вкус  и  цвет.  Никуда  не  делись  наградные  звёзды,  расширяющие  наши  возможности.  Враги  и  боссы  также  не  разочаруют,  пятнадцать  уровней  основной  кампании  проходятся  запоем,  а  ведь  есть  ещё  семь  дополнительных  карт  и  всё  это  доступно  на  трёх  сложностях  и  в  режиме  испытаний,  где  ко  всему  прочему  будут  введены  весьма  суровые  ограничения.  Есть  где  разгуляться  как  тактическому  гению,  так  и  человеку,  желающему  просто  отдохнуть.

Плюсы:  внимание  к  мелочам,  визуальный  стиль.

Минусы:  отсутствуют.

29408114.review:
I love this game. I am a huge fan of stratagy games, like any stratagy game. I have played from plants vs zombies sieres to the total war franchise to the civilization franchise. And I love the kingdom rush troligy(can I call it that?) This happens to be my favorite of the 3. 

Pros:
The towers
Yes, I love the towers. Each one brings a new aspect to the game. Each one has a different way you can use to bring a downfall apon your enemies. The towers have great designs, like the mech is awsome! I will take most of the game to fuly level up your towers, and most of a level to max out the abillities. So if you dont know..., there are 4 types of towers, barracks, artillary, archer, and mage. barracks spawn soldiers to fight, archers shoot low damage, but fast attacks. Artillary fires powerfull aoe attacks but slowley and mages use powerfull magic attacks. Each tower you will upgrade 3 times and then get a choice of 2 finale upgrades. Each finale upgrade does a different thing depending on your play styke.

Enemies:
There is a huge varaity of enemies in this game. Each collection of levels has a setting and the enemies fit the setting well. For example, the desert stage consists of bandits and scorpions. The only thing is that each stage has basicly a re-skinned version of the troll from the first game and the orc from the first game. But other then that you encounter new and unique enemies that you must adapt to defeat. 

Stages:
I metioned this a bit above, but there are a variaty of stages that you will fight through. You start in the desert, were you fight off worms from tremmers and bandits, go to the jungle and battle with the cannabalistic tribes, and finish the campiagn in the dark depths carvens and defeat the lizardmen. Once this is done, you unlock the halloween levels and the beach levels, and maybe a mushroom level(that might be in the first game I forget). Each stage has new enemies, sometimes towers, new terrian, and twists. 

Stratagy:
Your stragagy in this game is important! Why, becuase its a stratagy game. And each tower will play into it. I said above that each tower is different and brings new attacks and ways to bring your enemies to there knees. For example, the necrmancer can summon the souls of enemies you have defeated and have them fight for you. While the ax throwers can make enemies take more damage and remove magic ressistince.

Other

The screenshots:
I just want to say that the guy whose screenshots are getting overrun of a few of them.

The Haloween Levels
There back, there fun, not much else to say.

Cons

Less extra levels then the first game:
I love the extra levels from the first game, I think it was the most fun part, and there were like 10 new stages with like a total of 15-16 levels. This game I think has 3 new stages and 8 new levels, something like that. I would like to see the orcs and the trolls in frontiers. Also, for those who are completely lost becuase they dont have the first game, the extra levles, or bonas levels, were levels unlocked once the story was completed. They were extra hard and introduced new enemies and almost all ended in a boss fight. I wanted more once I beat the game.

Only new towers and heros:
Wouldn't it be cool too see the musket men supporting a mech? or Thor doing battle with savages? Nope, instead of also having the old towers and heros along with the new ones, we just get to new ones. F*cking sucks. Dont get me wrong, I like Necromancer more then archain wizerd and assassin more then templar knights, but, cant we have both?


9/10

Главные герои, режим кампании, разнообразные враги, дополнительные испытания и награды в виде дополнительных звезд, которые можно потратить  на улучшения войск, прокачка и многообразие главных героев - все это создает постоянный реиграбельный процесс, некоторые уровни вы будете переигрывать по нескольку раз, или потому что провалили задание или чтобы выйграть бонусы.  Рекомендую. Не зря она очень популярна на мобильных платформах.

29148654.review:
Very similar to its predecessor, but with new enemies and new towers, both of which have their own unique powers. Because of that, the strategies that worked before may not work as well for this game, so while the whole product feels familiar and unchanged, it's fresh and surprising at the same time. For example, in the original Kingdom Rush, you could usually get away with staring out a location with all the towers bought to the first level, but in Frontiers, you're better off focusing on one or two towers and upgrading them in the beginning due to the tougher enemies. 


The heroes are new as well, but only a handful of them are any good. Each one again changes your strategy for a level slightly due to their strengths and weaknesses. They won't win the war for you but some of them could bail you out of some problems if you play your cards right.

Great game, over 120 hours on this one and the first one, and that's not including the the Flash versions. Thumbs up.

29142960.review:
[h1]장점[/h1]
[b]1.더 편해진 조작[/b]
전편에서 불편했던 인터페이스가 개편되었습니다.
이제 마우스 우측버튼으로 선택해제가 가능하며(가장 편한부분) 영웅선택후 타워를 바로 선택가능하게되었습니다.(이전편에서는 마법, 영웅 선택시 스페이스바로 취소전까지는 선택해제 못함..)
문제가 개선되었다는건 정말 기쁜소식이죠.

[b]2.개선된 영웅시스템[/b]
전편에서는 영웅을 얻을뿐 성장시킨다는 개념이없었으며 매스테이지마다 1레벨부터 올라가는 방식이었습니다..이번편에서는 이부분도 개편되었습니다.
각영웅별로 유저가 직접 찍을수있는 스킬포인트가 주어지며 레벨이 스테이지 마다 리셋되는식이 아니라 10레벨까지 꾸준히 성장이 유지되는 방식으로 바뀌었습니다.
덕분에 육성의 재미와 더불어 초, 중반에 영웅의 역할이 크게 증가하였습니다.(초반에 한해 10레벨영웅으로 무쌍을 찍을수도있습니다.)
또한 [u]영웅들의 개성도 더욱 과감하게 표현되어[/u] 서로 특징이 완전히 다른 영웅을 운용하여 스테이지 공략에 색다른 재미를 부여합니다.

[b]3.한글화[/b]
폰트까지 어울리게 맞춰서 한글화 되어있습니다. 

[b]4.정성이 느껴지는 세계[/b]
여러 테마를 바탕으로 구성된 월드맵과 그 모습대로 매번 색다른 적들과 특수유닛, 보스몹이 존재하여 다음 스테이지에 기대감을 더해줍니다.
역시 아기자기한 세계의 묘사는 킹덤러쉬의 중요 컨탠츠라고 할만하네요.

[b]5.깨알 같은 디테일[/b]
전편의 패러디나 숨은 요소들을 찾는 재미는 이번편에서도 건재합니다. 새로운 스테이지마다 배경을 찬찬히 둘러보세요.


[h1]단점[/h1]
[b]1.여전히 너무 어려운 난이도[/b]
난이도의 빡빡함이 너무 과합니다. 지나친 상성또한 여전해서 이번편도 역시 잉여타워와 잉여병영이 존재하게되었습니다.(그나마 범위증가효과로 화살타워는 한두개 정도 지을만해졌습니다.)
밸런스부분에서 더 앞선 게임들의 경우 너무 타이트하고 극상성으로 만들기보다는 좀 느슨하게해서 유저로 하여금 여러가지 전술을 즐길수있게하는데반해 킹덤러쉬는 마치 정해진 공식이 있는것처럼 지나치게 꽉짜여져서 숨이 막힐수준의 밸런스를 보여줍니다.
타워디팬스를 좋아하는 유저들중에서도 킹덤러쉬를 기피하는 유저들의 주된이유가 이 장르 최대급으로 어려운 난이도 탓인걸 감안하면 안타까운 일입니다.
특히 먼 원거리에서 병영유닛을 한두방에 즉사시키는 도마뱀저격수같은 유닛은 너무 극단적인 상성 아닌가싶습니다...(병영의 잉여화 일등공신..)

[b]2.한글화 버그[/b]
한글화자체는 쌍수들어 환영할일이지만 가끔씩 글자가 찌그러지거나(좌우폭이 크게 찌그러져서 읽는게 불가능한 수준..) 업그레이드내용이 반영안된상태로 출력이 안되는 경우가있습니다.(예:드릴타워의 경우 1단계 업그레이드 내용이 2,3단계에서도 계속 출력됨.)
게임에 큰 지장을 주지는 않지만 소소한 버그들이 있네요.

[b]3.개선되지않은 AI[/b]
여전히 원거리 적에게 맞고있어도 미동도 하지않으며...적이 바로 옆을 지나가는데도 멍때리고있는 병사들을 보고있으면 멘탈을 유지하기 힘들어집니다.

[b]4.조촐한 스토리의 인상[/b]
전편도 시나리오가 크게 의미있는건 아니었지만...이번편은 마지막이야기라고 하기에는 (3편인 오리진은 과거이야기..) 너무 조촐한 느낌이드는게 아쉽습니다. 마지막 보스를 깰때면 "어?이놈이 최종 보스였어?"이런 느낌이 들정도로 이전편보다 이야기가 규모면에서 더 줄어들었다는게 아쉬움으로 남습니다.
사이사이 나오는 만화도 뭔가 전개과 동떨어진 꽁트를 보는 느낌으로 제대로 역할을 했다고 보기에는 어려울듯합니다.

[b]5.살짝 아쉬운 마무리[/b]
[list]
    [*]앤들리스모드 부제 : 이번편도 pc판은 앤들리스모드가 누락되었습니다.... 안타깝네요.T-T
    [*]남아도는 연구 포인트 : 이번편에서도 연구를 모두 올리고난뒤에도 연구 포인트가 계속 누적되는부분이 개선되지 않았네요. 찍을것도 없는 계속 쌓여가니 마감이 덜된 느낌이듭니다.
[/list]

29047197.review: A great addition to quite possibly the best tower defense series in gaming.  Frontiers implements a hero upgrading system and more powerful heroes overall.  The tradeoff is that the game difficulty has increased, and hero placement can mean the difference in an enemy slipping through.  Furthermore, while the base towers remain the same, there are entirely new tower upgrades to play with.  The later levels require you to strategically mix and match your towers in order to effectively deal with varying enemy types.  The game punishes you for spamming one type of tower.

28729405.review:
Продолжение легендарной игры жанра Tower Defence, где разработчики порадовали фанатов ещё большим набором героев с самыми различными способностями и фишками, новыми разнообразными уровнями, почти на каждом из которых есть своя особенность, которая может оказаться как и полезной, так и мешающая прохождению, новыми башнями удивительной мощи, и всё это закрепив очередной захватывающей стилизацией.
По началу казалось, что серия превратится в "конвейер", и эта часть будет отличаться только визуально. Но если вкусить её по-настоящему, то сразу становятся заметны отличия и изменения (в лучшую сторону). Так что не стоит делать поспешные выводы, играя в неё.
Настоятельно рекомендую опробовать игру тем, кто однажды увлекался первой частью, или мобильными версиями. Тем же, кто с ней не знаком, советую познакомиться. Даю слово, разочарованным никто не останется.

28708026.review:
[h1]谨以此好评纪念我们人生历程中那些不期而遇的感动瞬间。[/h1]
····················································
10/10    开天辟地之作（的完美续作）

记忆时而如溪水般清澈，
第一次看到KingdomRush系列是很多年前了，
在一个叫做“茶饭后”的精品Flash游戏网站。
当时开场LOGO甚至不是铁皮工作室Ironhide，
而是Flash游戏门户网站ArmerGames的剑盾标志。
时光总是在不经意间流逝，
默默的见证着物是人非日落月升。
如今的乌拉圭铁皮已经鼎鼎大名，
ArmerGames成为无数梦想的起点，
“茶饭后”也几经变迁、沧海桑田。
唯有用心方能铸就永恒经典，
KingdomRush的故事情节不断加深，
内容之丰富已是当初所不能想象，
早已横跨多个平台形成庞大系列。
我期待起源版本早日登录steam，
也相信前线之后的故事远未完结。

28706441.review:
首先，官方中文好评！字体的问题应该已经修复，完全没有评价里所说的看不清字体的问题。
KingdomRush系列从几年之前就开始玩，大学时代抱着越狱的手机玩破解版KR1玩的不亦乐乎，那会儿还能把内购英雄解锁，全通之后大呼过瘾！之后平板上玩了前线，起源。无奈一个个解锁英雄实在太贵，6块一个还有18块一个的。直到这次发现居然这里可以不用内购玩全英雄的，实在是舒服。
画面上，比手机平板等移动端的画面看着舒服多了，地图上仍然有许多可爱的彩蛋小成就。而且用键盘鼠标的体验也比之前强的多，空格键选择英雄，12键释放技能。大军混战中也不会手忙脚乱了！
游戏性上不用多说，尤其是兵营升级圣殿骑士时候喊的那句A Sword day,a red day让我觉得十分带感！
最后希望起源也能登陆steam！

28683819.review:
也许是最好的塔防游戏。
Kingdom Rush系列固有的如关卡地形丰富、可操作因素多等优点不再赘述。相较于尚显稚嫩的一代和画面比游戏本身好玩的三代，前线无疑做到了很好的平衡。
一代中，电塔男巫骑士过于强大，火枪与狂战几乎稀缺；三代中的兵营与英雄过度强大让其它塔失去了光泽。而前线中，鹰眼的范围加成，图腾的加伤，死灵的无限骷髅，大法的高爆与控场，地震的无差别AOE以及钻头秒杀，高达的全屏导弹与配合科技的高几率晕眩，在海战和万圣关卡中大显身手的刺客。唯一稍显弱势的只有圣殿骑士，但前线的防御塔平衡及存在感在三代中皆是最佳。
与三代凤凰的一枝独秀（卫兹南、飞机、大树强度虽也较高，但仍不及凤凰）相比，本作的英雄可堪大用的更多，骨龙、火龙、女巫的AOE，外星人的秒杀，沙王的沙兵及其本身的硬度都让这些英雄成为主流。尽管也有石头人、幻影等冷门英雄，但仍不失为英雄较为平衡的一作。
主线关卡在后期高达、地震和死灵的强势下显得难度略低（相较于一代而言），而海战的少塔及怪物全新的技能，万圣节的满月系统等都很好的为主线略显单一的玩法做了补充。
对于一个充满着可能性的塔防游戏而言，噩梦难度通关也许只是一个开始，限制塔数或塔种类，开发新的英雄玩法，都是十分有趣而有意义的挑战。

28587794.review:
首先要说的是这款游戏已经有了中文，并且中文字体已经有了补丁修正，想玩的玩家可以放心购买。

这是我至今为止玩过的最好玩的塔防游戏（请原谅我用“最”这个词，毕竟玩过的塔防不多，没有神作对比）。
已经一周目大致通关了，至今在收集星星的道路上。游戏中的防御塔有4种（箭，炮，法，兵）每一种又有两种不同的升级，所以就有了8种防御塔，每种塔的用处不同，不同的组合可以应对不同的敌人，这种策略非常让人着迷。比较有特色的是有很多的英雄（自己把很多英雄都升满了，正在玩最新出的几个），英雄有不同的技能。画面也很有趣，让人看不厌。

如果说非要说点缺点的话就是希望防御塔能够更丰富一点，增加更多的可能，希望能继续更新下去（给出中文的态度点赞~\(≧▽≦)/~）

28384993.review:
Kingdom Rush: Frontiers is a tower defence game developed and published by Ironhide Game Studio. It was released in July 2016. Frontiers features a campaign with various storylines in which you progress throughout the game upon successful completion of each level. This review will cover the campaign and the gameplay.

[h1] [b] Campaign [/b] [/h1]
Frontiers features a very fun campaign. There are several stories within the game that incorporate different enemy characters. For instance, the forest allows you to play levels against the cannibal tribe. A second example is near the ocean of you defending against enemy pirates or sea creatures. Frontiers features two extra game modes alongside the campaign, heroic and iron. To play both modes, you must play a level in the campaign mode and earn three out of three stars. These modes add replayability and difficulty to the game because Heroic adds some challenges to a level and Iron bans certain towers within the level, adding an extra layer of strategy. And, the game features 20 different level that amount to 105 upgrade points. I thoroughly enjoyed the campaign. 

There are various settings in the game, allowing for levels to be in different climates such as the jungle, ocean, mountains. Frontiers shines in the strategic element that you cannot use the same strategy of tower placement each level due to the various types of enemies, but you can create a basic guideline of what works best against an enemy. Ironhide flourishes in creating beautifully designed diverse levels that are not repetitive, are simple, and emphasise strategy. I completed the campaign in 20 hours on normal difficulty, but I only earned 46 out of 105 stars. I found my play through to be enjoyable and not boring because I played the game more in a casual setting and that allowed me to enjoy it instead of quickly playing through it in one day. Back to the point, I believe there is enough content for forty hours of gameplay.

[h1] [b] Gameplay [/b] [/h1]
Frontiers incorporates various heroes that are diverse in character and have different abilities. You use these heroes when you play the levels and they gain experience, which levels their character up to level ten. I really like the heroes because it adds a simple and fun mechanic to the game, particularly the diversity in heroes and their strengths and weaknesses against enemy heroes. Furthermore, the heroes complement the four different ally towers in the game, artillery, archery, mage, and barracks. The different towers obviously have different strengths, weaknesses, and have upgrade paths that are liberal in levelling up according to your enemies in the level. For example, if you face heavy armoured enemies and fast-moving wolves, it would be best to upgrade your level three Wizard Tower into a level four Necromancer tower over the level four Archmage tower because the earlier has high damage but also spawns skeletons when you defeat enemies, contrast to the Archmage tower that has extreme damage but very minimal map control compared to the Necromancer tower. I like the variety of towers and upgrades though because the player needs to be strategic about their enemies within a level because not every tower or upgrade is suitable for every condition.

The game also has some neat voice acting that I think accurately portrays the type of personalities of each character, ally unit or enemy unit. I found there to be a hint of humour within some characters dialogue lines and I think the overall tone of the characters, their dialogues, and voice acting fits the casual tone of the game. Furthermore, to further capture the casual nature of the game is the artwork that mixes comic-book graphic elements, which I think adds to the overall gameplay and storyline experience.

[h1] [b] Conclusion [/b] [/h1]
I highly recommend Frontiers. I played the original Kingdom Rush in Flash on the Internet and I believe it has evolved since then without heavily altering the core mechanics of it. In saying that, I thoroughly enjoyed playing Frontiers and I found barely anything of fault with it if I am honest, I knew what to expect with this game. I particularly highlight the map design and the stories as a core component out of the game because that is what adds the uniqueness and continuous freshness to the game without staleness. Therefore, I highly recommend Kingdom Rush: Frontiers at the full price of USD$9.99.

[h1] [b] Rating [/b] [/h1]
10/10

[h1] [b] Pros [/b] [/h1]
	- Map design.
	- Various storylines within the game that take you on a journey through different settings.
	- Diversity in ally and enemy characters and their character traits.
	- Frontiers strategic element that alters every level.

[h1] [b] Cons [/b] [/h1]
	- If I had to nit-pick, I would have liked some more towers.

If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AntwogReviews]Antwog's Analysis (Reviews)[/url].

http://store.steampowered.com/app/458710/

28207165.review:
Всем привет! 
В этот день я наконец решился сделать обзор, надеюсь прочитая именно это , вы решите покупать или нет.
Начнем с 
ПЛЮСОВ

+ Геймплей - Не знаю как другим людям, но прошёл игру я  с большой улыбкой на лице, очень затянула , ни разу не наскучала. Пожалуй лучшая TD в которую я играл, и пожалуй лучшая часть серии(ПОКА ЧТО).

+ Графика - Очень приятноя графика. Простая и мималистичная, но не смотря на это ТАКАЯ КРАСИВАЯ.

+ Герои - В отличии от прошлой части прокачка героев сделана намного лучше , сам выбираешь, какое умение нужно прокачать сначала.

+ Саундреки - Музыка реально в тему и не надоедает.

+ Разнообразие - множество видов врагов, карт, улучшений башен.

+ Активность разработчиков  - Выходят обновления добавляющие новых героев, персонажей. Еще заметил, что они отвечают на все вопросы, обзоры, выполняют просьбы - типо chinese pls.
+ Хочу еще поблагодарить за большое наличие языков и за шикарные ачивки.

А сейчас начнутся минусы , их мало и они не значительные.

- Уровней маловато, игра не успеват наскучить, а игру прошёл вдоль и поперек , надеюсь на новую часть.

-  Плохая оптимизация на моем ноутбуке - Fps 15-25 не больше.

 Обзор получился не таким какой я хотел, слишком длинный, но я уже перехожу к выводу.

Игру я конечно рекомендую для всех,  она вам точно понравится, возможно даже затянет.
9.5/10 MUST HAVE!!!

28078905.review:
Kingdom Rush, ah Kingdom Rush. Ile czasu spędziłem odpierając ataki hord potworów? Sam nie wiem, ale nie żałuję ani sekundy. Niespecjalnie żałuję nawet tego, że przez ten genialny tower defense musiałem poprawiać egzamin... Po jakimś czasie zrobiłem wszystko co się w grze zrobić dało i poszła ona w zapomnienie. Do czasu gdy światło dzienne ujrzał Kingdom Rush Frontiers! Nowy Kingdom Rush to nowe mapki, nowi przeciwnicy, wieże, aktywne elementy otoczenia i wiele, wiele więcej. Nie zmieniło się tylko jedno: gra wciąga jak bagno.

Zasady rozgrywki są banalnie proste i nie różnią się specjalnie od innych gier tego typu. Rozgrywamy kampanię składającą się z 15 misji. Każda z nich to mapka, na której przyjdzie nam odpierać ataki wrogiej armii. Reguły są proste: przeciwnik wchodzi z jednej strony mapy, a my mamy nie dopuścić do tego by jego jednostki przedarły się na drugą stronę. W tym celu budujemy i rozwijamy struktury obronne w postaci wież i baraków. Wieże dzielą się na trzy podstawowe typy: strzelcy, magowie i artyleria. Każdy typ wieży ma własne wady, zalety i zdolności specjalne, które możemy odblokować po rozwinięciu budynku na najwyższy poziom. Baraki w przeciwieństwie do wież nie ostrzeliwują przeciwnika, ale wystawiają w naszym imieniu do walki małą grupkę wojaków, których główną funkcją jest spowolnienie marszu przeciwnika. Jakby tego było mało po każdej ukończonej misji jesteśmy oceniani. W zależności od tego jak nam poszło dostajemy określoną liczbę gwiazdek (od jednej do trzech), które możemy wymienić na ulepszenia dla wież i zaklęć. Co ważnie nie ma ryzyka, że źle zainwestujemy ciężko zapracowane punkty, bo w każdej chwili możemy je zresetować i rozdać ponownie.

+配乐
+画面风格（反正我很喜欢）
+没有付费英雄（相对移动端来说是很大的优点）
+各种彩蛋，各种跑错片场

-无尽关卡没什么意思，不如多设计些普通关卡

KRF is a clear example of Mies van der Rohe phrase "Less is More". 
Not the best game, not the best graphics but KRF shines by itself.

+ Simple but easy and well thought out mechanics which makes playing an enjoying experience.
+ Simple 2D graphics but perfectly done that fit game mechanics. 
+ Maybe a bit short if you play on easy but the veteran option  makes some post-campaigns a hell to complete, which is    
pretty good and I love having to think about a real strategy instead of placing towers, upgrade them and complete 
every level without effort.
+ I found the voice acting, heroes, cameos and other sttuf to be original and funny. 
+ Upgraded from KR 1, and I like it since you see devs putting effort to it.

- Would be great if the tower defense could be mixed with some sort of role playing such as a real campaign with 
cinematics, more than reading a few lines before entering a level, conversations or even crafting some materials to be 
heroes equipment and have some bonus while equiped.

Excelent game 9/10

Sometimes you want a tower defense game.  Sometimes you want the humor of Monty Python (or at least Pythonesque). Sometimes you want a serious challenge.  And sometimes, once in a very great while, you want all three at once.  Enter Kingdom Rush Frontiers... a delightful, often maddening, silly yet seriously challenging game that will keep you up at night trying to earn JUST ONE MORE STAR!  

A successful follow up to the original Kingdom Rush, the Steam version includes several free updates to keep you challenged and laughing your a** off.  Employ dwarven artiliary, elven archers, pious paladins, and a host of others against the teeming hordes of the forces of EVIL!  Heck, you might even meet a hero or three along the way to help you turn the tide.

26961072.review:
[h1]小学时的回忆[/h1]
记得在上小学的时候，还不知道steam这个平台，我们只有4x99
记得电脑课自由时间宝贵，大家都玩赛x号，而我喜欢玩皇城突袭
游戏里的每一句语音都特别有感觉，用我蹩脚的英语中二地和别人讲
如今出了frontiers, 知道了steam，我立马入了正版，这一过就是几年
皇城突袭给我带来的不仅仅是游戏性，更多的是我当年美好的回忆
大家各奔东西了，希望有幸看到这篇评测的人能珍惜自己身边的一切

[h1]最经典的塔防[/h1]
在这里你拥有4种防御塔：法师塔，弓箭塔，炮台和兵营
兵营：阻挡敌人的去路让其他塔输出，升级可以加甲和生命，最终是刺客或战士
炮台：AOE群伤，攻击速度慢，升级伤害变高，最终是大AOE塔或炮台机器人
弓箭：射速快，对轻甲伤害高，升级加射速和伤害，最终是弩堡或图腾塔
法师：射速慢，对重甲伤害高，升级加伤害，最终是死灵塔或大法师
除了兵营升级其它塔都可以加射程，塔的最终形态的加点就不讲了，不然剧透太多
某些地图可以给你特殊的塔，是已经造好的，可以加属性点
总体而言就是利用这些塔的组合防御进攻，和你的英雄还有技能（火球和援军）
建议玩一下初代 Kingdom Rush, 因为本作几乎没有教程

[h1]咳咳，这才是正片[/h1]
Kingdom Rush, 皇家保卫军，皇城突袭等等，原版，发行日期 2011-07-28，涵盖了PC,iPad,iPhone
这一作前线也有手机版，画面可以感觉到好了很多，字体高清，但还是一样的画风
+新增了不同的塔的最终升级形态，但一级塔还是和原版一样
+新增了不同的英雄，以及英雄的天赋系统
+新增了不同的天赋，用于塔，援军以及火球
+更有挑战性，需要操作英雄以及集结点
+更多有趣的兵种

-劝退不熟悉游戏的新玩家，因为普通难度都难打
-没中文，但是基本看得懂, 希望下一作能添加 Everyone is waiting for Chinese!
-秘制崩溃过一次，后来更新显卡驱动解决

？到我写这篇评测时，游戏还在更新（英雄和关卡）？

月更新跳票辣！希望圣诞能翻译好

我心中的第一塔防 10/10

26907002.review: One of the best, if not the best tower defense experiences you may have.  Buy it without fear. Fun is guaranteed.

26901365.review: One of the best tower defence games I've ever played. I have been a fan of this developer and series since the first Kingdom Rush was released, and each installment continues to amaze me and make me crave more. Anyone who like tower defence games MUST own this game!

26897630.review:
很有特色的塔防游戏，移植自手机平台。
私以为难度较之手机平台有提高，但英雄不再通过内购手段获得，后期解锁一些较为imba的英雄后也能一定程度上进行中和。虽然各防御塔的天赋和属性平衡还存在一些微妙的问题，但颇具挑战的关卡设计和精致的美术风格，加以一些恰到好处的幽默和彩蛋，让游戏流程变得十分让人享受。中后期以及高难度下的关卡即使拥有所有升级也需要一定的策略，过关成就感满满。
8/10 推荐给所有不讨厌塔防的玩家。

12 月23日更新： 添加了新的中文字体，虽然不甚美观，但较之之前的版本已经很出色了，建议尝试~

26742115.review:
Whether or not you liked the original Kingdom Rush will determine whether or not you like its sequel.

There's nothing really different about the mechanics - there's just new, fun variants on the old theme. The tower specializations have differed (and are quite interesting) but the basic purposes are still the same. The enemies are different but the general premise is unchanged. There are new heroes, but the purpose of having a hero on the field is the same. So if you liked KR, you'll like KRF; and conversely if KR wasn't your thing, KRF is not sufficiently different that your opinion will be altered.

So, assuming you enjoyed KR, you'll find KRF an enjoyable revisit. It's got plenty of new challenges, interesting new towers, and incorporates a subsystem of certain enemies' abilities being "magical" so that you can negate them with a particular tower upgrade.

Forewarning: The final boss of the campaign is kind of BS (spoiler: it can just straight-up delete a few of your towers and there's nothing you can do to stop it) but that's mostly just going to cause you to retry the stage and adjust your strategy (namely: keep leftover money instead of spending it all on upgrades at the end of the last wave).

26726751.review:
Great and fun game as well as addicting. It does have bumps on the road however and can be incredibly frustrating, especially with the introduction of the Sand Wraith, an upgraded version of the enemy spawn unit from the first one.

The pro's of this game have been listed by many people, maps are enjoyable, able to find and click things for a bit of amusement, and towers are a ton of fun to figure out which works and doesn't. Feels like the old one but with updated and new versions that feel at home in this game. Which is weird to see someone list that as a con but honestly a Paladin guild would not fit in a desert setting as opposed to a assassins guild they have in this one. 

The main cons of this game that I feel are the hero's, introducing a very grind system into the game that should not be a part of it especially since you can only use  your hero's on the 'campaign' parts of these maps, they're taken away during heroic and Iron situations. The hero's themselves are enjoyable and appear to all be unique and fun but very weak as well to the Desert Archer swarms which can be a bit difficult to handle if somone is new due to how fast they can rip the hero apart. The other part would be the Sand Wraith. The first game had a Necromancer which did a similiar thing of spawning 4 skeletons peroidically while having a ranged attack but easy to handle due to how far into the game they're introduce, giving the player a chance to be able to handle them. The hero's as well were capable of beating on them due to progressing in levels during the campaign, not a grind mechanic this one has. They work with spawning a coffin at a random location, ahead of them, in the samel lane they are (so yes they can spawn past your militia barracks). This is a huge problem as they'll also spawn more than just 4 mummies so easily able to get swarmed and suddenly over burdened. This wouldn't be an issue if they were somewhat squishy but they have half as much health as an Executioner who's supposed to be the Ogre (except he has one hit kills majority of the time) with 1400 health. The Sand Wraith's stats are HP: 700 DPS: 30-60 ranged AR/MR: none MS: Slow and thankfully only take 1 hp away. The bad part though with its slow MS it spawns more than enough tombs to release a swarm of mummies and towers will focus the mummies over the Sand wraith which you have zero control over. They'll also kill your militia quickly if you try and move them to handle it. Early on Hero's will not be able to handle it or help as well. I did the mistake of not leveling up my reinforcements and meteors apperantly as that's the only way I find to slow them down and when the wraiths are distracted with melee attacks they'll still spawn mummies. This is something of a huge turn off for me as i've actually RQ now due being so quickly being overwhelmed by 3 wraiths who spawned in close succession (without rushing the next wave in). 

Outside of those two things this game is once again incredibly enjoyable and a very welcoming feel to the TD genre. It can be frustrating, especially with tower placements at times, but that's the challenging part of it as well. Finding the best ways to maximize your Militia and defense towers range/damage. No tower is better than the other as each one is required to beat a map, the hero's are a welcoming part (in my mind) to the TD genre. The upgrades can feel a bit forceful in what you have to get first in this one however but make the game give a reason to actually get more stars and do better.  I still recommend the game, even though the Sand Wraiths are a huge turn off as well as the grinding feature in a TD game.
