26523830.review:
A great TD game. I love the Kingdom Rush series of tower defense games. They're usually pretty well balanced. Even on hard, most maps still allow for some variation. so you're not stuck with only using a specific pattern to win a map.

Overall, the game is excellently made. Lots of references to popculture, like the previous one.

not to say that there aren't some cons:
like the first game, you accumulate a ton of stars that just sit there and nothing can be done with them.
no way to make or dl user-made maps.
new hero system isn't necessarily an improvement over the old. while experimentation is still somewhat possible, the repetition to get later-stage heroes leveled up is a disincentive and most players probably won't bother.
there could have been more challenges or more varied challenges instead of just the 6 wave / 1 wave. (user generated maps could probably addressed this in a creative way)

To reiterate, KR:F is a great TD game, but because the KR series was initially conceived just for the smart phone and flash game markets it lacks some of the features that would make it an even better series for the PC market.

"Stay Frosty!"

26237535.review:
TL;DR-- A really disappointing entry into the TD genre, do not buy.

A critical component of your defense is rally-point AI-driven, and as such is notoriously fickle, frequently blind to threats, and leaks like a squozen sponge. Your towers are inconsistent, lie about their ranges to your face, and upgrade descriptions are often vague and unhelpful. Cap it all off with critical 'Champion' characters who not only must be manually directed but levelled *individually*, and you have a recipe for a game that starts frustrating and quickly veers into boring: After all, there's also no visible-map pausing, no fast-forwarding, and no checkpointing... All of which could be sort-of kind-of forgiven if the maps didn't take damn near half an hour even as early as the fourth or fifth stage.

26006386.review:
[h1]The best Tower Defense series on Steam, hands down.[/h1]

[h1][b]Score: 8.5/10[/b][/h1]

Pros:
[list][*] Rich in detail, as per usual.
[*] Distinct units and towers.
[*] Beautifully crafted visual experience.
[*] New mechanics compared to the first game - new enemy paths opening mid-stage and stage-related objectives, which can prove to be helpful during the run.
[*] A few more interactive, map-specific units compared to the initial game.
[*] Great music and SFX.
[*] Lots of hidden achievements throughout the stages.[/list]

Cons:
[list][*] Worse hero progression approach compared to the first game. Results in quite a bit of unnecessary grind to get all the heroes maxed, where - in the end - you will stick to only a select few anyway, due to their specific abilities. Do note that this hinders the overall experience in no way, really, as it is a post-game issue; one can easily finish the game with the starting hero, not having tried the others at all.
[*] Sudden difficulty spikes in a couple of stages (like 2 or so) that can throw you off.
[*] No real incentive to play at any difficulty higher than Casual (Normal or Veteran), as there are no achievements related to it.
[*] Game suffers from the same issue as the first one, being that once you get to doing [b][i]Heroic[/i][/b] and [b][i]Iron[/i][/b] difficulties, you end up with an absurd amount of additional [b][i]Stars[/i][/b] that cannot be used on anything, as the upgrades available in the game only utilize so many of those.
[*] Some issues with Cloud saving (people mentioning those issuse are in huge minority, though)[/list]

As you can tell by the score, the cons listed didn't really affect it much and should be treated as "I wish this was in the game" complaints of a die-hard fan, more than anything else.
26006386.developer_response:
Hi Azure,
Thank you so much for the great review!

Just a small comment on the extra stars. We made sure that the game gives more starts than you need, so that players that can't finish all stages with 3 stars can still have enough upgrades to deal with the final boss. 

We are now developing KR4 and the extra stars issue is part of the conversation, so we might actually do something to improve this mechanic. :)

25931184.review:
I'm glad to see that the developers of Kingdom Rush are sticking to what I consider to be the quintessential tower defense game. This title is "more of the same" but I can't stress enough that this is absolutely a good thing. 
Often, a sequel entirely overshadows its predecessor to a point of invalidating any reason to return to the first game - in this case, I'd strongly recommend picking up both. It's perhaps better to see this game as a gigantic expansion to the first, protected from accusations that it should have just been DLC by the first game's colossal amount of extra content existing beyond the main campaign and within the base game and the large number of variations that Frontiers has made to tech tree progression, enemy types, and map interactivity.

What it boils down to is simple - if you like tower defense games, buy both of the Kingdom Rush ones. If you're unsure about the genre, I'd strongly recommend either of these two as a great introduction to the genre.

Игра очень хорошая, однако отзыв отрицательный в силу следующих причин:

1. Она ничем не отличается от бесплатной флэшевой версии, которая есть в интернете. Первая часть игры (Kingdom Rush) была существенно доработана по сравнению с бесплатной флэшевой версией, в ней были новые уровни, новые враги и новые боссы. Здесь ничего этого нет, всё точно такое же, что и во флэше, разработчики не старались.

2. Последний босс - это какая-то адская жесть. Все миссии прошел без проблем на ветеране, а последний босс просто уничтожает все мои башни, и не остается никого, кто мог бы его атаковать. Чудовищная имба. Очень разочаровывает и оставляет неприятные впечатления.

3. Достижение "10.000 монет" ассасинами - очень долгое и нудное. Для его получения пришлось тупо десять раз проходить одни и те же уровни, строя одних ассасинов. Тоже очень разочаровывает.

А в целом игра классная.

[i]Just look at this fancy, detailed graphics! Butchering tons of cute monsters carrying huge, glowing whips never felt more heart-warming.[/i]

[h1]Why is this gud?[/h1]

For real, the biggest pro this game offers is its design. You can't do else but love what you see there, just like watching cat videos on Youtube.

Each of the 3 difficulties is well balanced, with the hardest one being a tough challenge where you might need to restart the round a few times and rage about this one dragon flying past your 10 artillery towers.

Did you already play Kingdom Rush and enjoyed it? Why do you still struggle to buy this one? The game's style remains the same, towers and heroes are different so you don't get bored!

[h1]This sounds like brainwashing, are there any cons?[/h1]
The price of currently €10 compared to the playtime of approx. 30h when doing every stage in normal, heroic and iron is maybe a little high, especially for a tower defense game. Nonetheless I spent it and don't regret it since it offers a nice, relaxed atmospere to play.

25589043.review:
Everything you loved from the original Kingdom Rush shows up in Frontiers, plus much more. 

The insanely addictive Tower Defense game is back! Ironhide brings you the same great art style, defense mechanics, new and old tower upgrades, a plethora of new enemies, AND to spice things up, we have unique Heroes to command on the battle field.

Now, I've read a couple reviews which put the Hero system in a negative light. Personally, for me I really enjoyed it. Honestly, I played with one hero the whole time. Mirage, which is a clone creating, thief type Hero. Now, let me tell you that each Hero is very unique with their own pros and cons. I gravitated towards Mirage because her abilities matched my playstyle. I also messed around with the Wizard, the Alien dude and the final Dragon that you get. Ultimately, always coming back to Mirage. The Heroes are here for you to test and have fun with, not to be over whelming on the battlefield, which they are not.

Kingdom Rush is my favorite Tower Defense game and it's my favorite game to just pick up and play for 20 minutes or so at a time. 

We will also be receiving FREE MONTHLY UPDATES. Yup. Ironhide is one of those game developers that [i]gets[/i] it. The last week of each month we will receive two new heroes and a new campaign. This game is loaded for only $10. Well worth the price.

The game itself takes around 12 hours to complete. If you want to collect all the stars so you can fully max out your traits, then you'll be putting a bit more time into it. I'm at around 25 hours as of this review and I'm coming close to 100% completion of the base game.


I can't recommend this game enough! It's truly a gem.

25559381.review:
Super jeu, très addictif.
Tout est vraiment parfait, le plaisir, le fun de jouer avec une stratégie qui paye.
C'est assez intense et très prenant. Bref, un gameplay parfait, une réalisation parfaite.
Mais... Seul gros défaut bien caché : passé la première moitié du jeu, la difficulté devient rapidement INJOUABLE si vous n'adoptez pas exactement la combinaison de tour prévue par les développeurs.
En clair, la courbe de progression du jeu est après la première moitié, brutalement exponentielle; pour rien, car les levels d'avant étaient parfaitement jouables. Et c'est vrai si vous prévoyez la combinaison prévue, vous le passez juste juste comme par magie. Vraiment dommage car la première moitié était très équilibrée. Là c'est devenu carrément impossible, très désiquilibré, malgré de multiples stratégies très efficaces avant. Et donc impossible d'avoir du plaisir à se faire rétamer. Vraiment dommage et très frustrant. Je ne vois pas l'intérêt de multiplier par 6 la difficulté d'un level à l'autre. Gros gros regret là dessus car j'adorai ce jeu. Donc je recommande, mais uniquement pour la première moitié; le reste n'étant tout simplement pas jouable sauf à être devin.

Kingdom Rush Frontier segue a mesma jogabilidade e a tematização do antigo Kingdom Rush que já fiz análise aqui na Steam [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ag00nY/recommended/246420]Segue Link para a mesma Aqui![/url]

[b]Bom e o que mudou então?[/b]
Basicamente tudo se formos levar em consideração alguns fatores...
Mesmo que o game esteja parecido, mudaram TODOS os Heróis, TODAS as torres especiais, Grande parte dos inimigos, e TODOS os mapas e tudo que cada mapa pode te oferecer, como eastereggs e ativáveis.
E com todas essas mudanças o jogo voltou a ser algo incrível de jogar e viciante, onde você passa horas jogando e querendo sempre completa-lo 100%
Não sei se ele ficou um pouco mais difícil ou eu que ando enferrujado com TD's, mas achei ele mais complicado que o primeiro, mas nada impossível.
Se vale a pena? poxa!
CLARO! O jogo é fenomenal dos pés a cabeça, e já estava na hora mesmo de importarem ele da versão Mobile para a PC, e fizeram um ótimo porte, o jogo conta com todas as resoluções disponíveis no mercado e super bem otimizado e funcional.
Agora só falta eles adicionarem tudo que falta da versão Mobile para o PC, mas já esta garantido que iremos ter um Game completo como foi o primeiro através de pequenas atualizações conforme os meses passam.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[i][list]
[*]Jogo viciante e tão legal quando o seu antecessor sem fugir do seu modo clássico de entretenimento
[*]Mapas, unidades, heróis e cenários totalmente novos e bem trabalhados
[*]Atualizações gratuitas a cada um certo período de tempo até termos um jogo bem mais completo e similar a versão mobile em questão de conteúdo.
[*]Conquistas Steam e Cartinhas colecionáveis com preços medianos.
[/list][/i]

[b]Contras:[/b]
[i][list]
[*]Falta bastante heróis que são adquiridos através de micro transações pela versão mobile
[*]Talvez o preço? Depende de cada pessoa eu acho :P
[/list][/i]

[b]Conclusão final...?
SUPER RECOMENDADO![/b]

25407279.review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

Kingdom Rush Frontiers ist ein Tower Defense und der nächste Teil der erfolgreichen Serie. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Kingdom Rush: Frontiers (KRF) verfügt derzeit über 18 Level, 46 verschiedene Feinde, 4 Basistürme mit je zwei unterschiedlichen Spezialisierungen und 9 verschiedene Helden. 

Genau wie im ersten Teil der Serie, kann man die Helden erst entsperren, wenn man ein gewisses Level abgeschlossen hat. Jeder spielt sich anders, bringt nützliche Fähigkeiten mit und   kann Maximal Level 10 erreichen, dadurch bekommt er Fähigkeitspunkte, die man auf 5 verschieden Skillbäume verteilen kann. Es bieten sich dadurch viele Möglichkeiten und Strategien, um die einzelnen Level abzuschließen. Zu jedem Level gibt es eine kleine Geschichte, die man nachlesen kann. Wenn man ein neues Gebiet betritt, wird die Story mit einer kleinen Sequenz erzählt. Nach Abschluss eines Level, bekommt man Sterne, diese kann man im Upgrademenü investieren, um deine Türme oder Fähigkeiten zu verbessern. Die Türme haben nun mehr verschiedene Spezialisierungen, als im ersten Teil. Die neuen Möglichkeiten ermöglichen es dir, deine Strategie zu überdenken und einen Weg zufinden, effektiv diese neuen Türme zusammen mit neuen Helden zu verwenden, um die Ebenen und Herausforderungen zu schlagen.

[h1] Grafik / Sounds [/h1]

Die gleiche schöne Kunst ist wieder vorhanden, der Kingdom Rush ausmacht. Die Karte ist animiert und jedes noch so kleine Detail ist toll anzusehen. Die Entwürfe der neuen Türme sind groß und die Feinde sind einzigartig für Frontiers. Die Musik spiegelt die Atmosphäre des Spiels und wurde gut integriert.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ frische Brise, in einer vertrauten Umgebung
+ viele Helden und Feinde
+ guter Wiederspielwert
+ süchtiges Gameplay
+ interessante Geschichte
+ neue Upgrade-Möglichkeiten
+ keine Mikrotransaktionen
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- Levels sind leichter, als beim Vorgänger

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

BRUH

I have SEEN some of these maps before

You're reusing map layouts! The first two levels are straight out of Kingdom Rush!

I want none of my money back, though, this remains one of the best TD franchises around and weirdly you won't find many better TD games on Steam, even though this is straight up a Mobile / Browser kinda game and would have been on Newgrounds in 2002, not for sale in a shop. Whatever.

The thing this game does so well is combining TD and RTS in a way that's extremely accessible and scales well to offer less or more of a challenge depending on the game mode. They've already had tremendous success with the first game, this is absolutely "More Of What Works." Not a ton of changes but some new additions and a better way of handling the hero mechanic as well do provide some incentive to try the game out if you're a Kingdom Rush fan but you're worried you might get bored. Still, it's very much the same sort of gameplay experience - it just happens to be one of the better 2D TD games around.

25186884.review:
Disgregard my time, I've played this game to completion outside of Steam.

A 100% upgrade to the already stellar Kingdom Rush, Frontiers improves upon everything that made the original fantastic, along with some new quite interesting twists.
Yeah I played this one in Programming too. I didn't do that well in that class, but it had little to do with paying attention and more like, I loved to hard-code, ok? I liked controlling everything, and the coding was always full of bugs, and here I am three years later.

Anyway. New heroes, you get your first one right away, and Alric makes me happy. I like Blackthorne the best, as when he uses his pistol, it one-shots minor foes, and I always found that funny. He's got a parrot too. I like birds.

Branching towers are even better now. I couldn't see a use for the sorcerer in the original, which was unfortnate. Frontiers walks up to you and whispers in your ear, something that you most definitely want to hear; "necromancers". The wizard branches into a high-power, slow casting Archmage, or the glorious bringer of death via the dead, the necromancer. He can spawn horseman. Mhmm. He can spawn death himself. Why wouldn't you want that. AND HE CAN SPAWN THREE OF THEM. AND THEIR KILLS ADD TO THE ALREADY IMPRESSIVE AMOUNT OF SKELETONS THAT WILL EXIST. 

Many many ways to beat the new, more diverse maps, new and cool dudes to watch flop over into the sand, and fun quriks going on off to the side. Like mermaids that flop back into the water upon a click. Or a frog that breaks out into song and dance.

To say that this game is the perfect and most glorious possible Tower Defense game might just be an understatment.

It took Ironhide two games to do what Bloons TD still can't do in like what. 10 games now?

10/10
If you love Tower Defenses, add this to your steam library as soon as now.

Incredibly cute hoards of tiny yet detailed enemies get smashed, zapped, pierced, drilled, clobbered, smiten, and so on and on - and they still never give up. Wave after wave. Adorable colorful animations make this game not only fun to play, but benefit in design: it is easy to see what is going on in the battlefield and react in time. This is precisely what makes a good tower defense game. A good perspective and overview.

Kingdom Rush is the best tower defense game on Steam, next to the original edition. An absolute blast to play, but also challenging, and requires some strategical thinking. Of course if that ain't your thing, there is an easier game mode. It quickly became one of my favorite games, and sort of even ruined other tower defense games, because I always keep longing for more Kingdom Rush instead.

I've been playing Kingdom Rush since the early Flash / ArmorGames days and every time this game arrives on a new platform I can't resist to buy it and play it again -- It's just so.much.fun.

And with the PC port(s) they've simply outdone themselves. It's smooth as silk, the HD graphics and the art style are gorgeous and there is just so much love in all the small details. Just take a look at the animations of the environment in each single stage or the world map. And don't get me started with the sound and all the film references / easter eggs like the Wilhelm scream if an enemy is shot while climbing :-)

The extende challenge modes on each stage are also a lot of fun and finishing an iron challenge is always rewarding. The game feels a little bit easier then the first one but that's very welcome because the first one was partly tough as nails if not even slightly frustrating (I'm looking at you Level 3 - "Pagras" ;-).

So in the end there's really nothing you can do wrong if you buy this game and I'm sure that you will enjoy it just as much as I do.

Here's hoping that someday the third part will be released for PC too ;-)

24926042.review:
Frontiers is a direct sequel to the original Kingdom Rush. There are new enemies, new heroes, and new specialized towers to experiment with, but the interface - down to the first three upgrades of each tower - should be familiar to anyone that's played Kingdom Rush before. Heroes, however, now gain permanent levels along with their own skill trees which adds a further sense of progression and greater range of options. Those options come in handy as difficultly has a habit of suddenly spiking in the middle of a level forcing one to adapt quickly or face starting back at wave one.
This installment is not quite as lengthy as its predecessor, but free updates, including several new heroes, have already been promised to bridge the gap. However short it is at the moment, Kingdom Rush Frontiers delivers plenty of the same tower defense brilliance, background details, and pop culture references that made the original such a favorite in the genre - which is more than enough to justify its modest price tag.

24919498.review:
[h1]Introdução[/h1]
[b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] é a sequência de Kingdom Rush, sendo o segundo jogo na série. Originalmente um jogo de [i]flash[/i], e, depois, um app, [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] mantém a dinâmica inovação no gênero de [i]Tower Defense[/i] estabelecida pela série, em um cenário completamente novo, com novas torres, heróis e inimigos.

[h1]Análise[/h1]
Após jogar o lançamento de Kingdom Rush no Steam, eu já sabia o que esperar de sua sequência no Steam: uma portabilidade excelente, com jogabilidade altamente fluída e com poucos (ou nenhum) problemas de funcionalidade.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Em [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b], um jogo que segue o gameplay comum do gênero [i]Tower Defense[/i], cada fase tem como objetivo de defender um ponto final de um caminho em que os inimigos percorrem; se os inimigos ultrapassam esse ponto final, ocorre a penalidade, que no caso é a perda de pontos de vida. Ao se chegar a 0 pontos de vida, o jogador perde a fase e terá que recomeçá-la. Cada fase tem ondas de inimigos, e é possível, assim que a onda atual termina, de mandar a próxima onda atacar imediatamente sem tempo de espera, em troca de ouro.

Para defender esse ponto final, o jogador tem à sua disposição torres que podem ser construídas e aprimoradas, o que custa ouro que é conseguido ao se derrotar inimigos. Diferente de certos jogos do gênero, a série Kingdom Rush apresenta lugares específicos em que as torres podem ser construídas (enquanto que, em outros jogos, os únicos lugares que as torres não podem ser construídas são os caminhos em que os inimigos percorrem), portanto, trazendo um elemento extra de estratégia em jogo.

Assim como seu predecessor, [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] apresenta 4 tipos de torres que podem ser construídas: [i]arqueiros[/i], [i]soldados[/i], [i]artilharia[/i] e [i]magia[/i]. Todas as torres possuem um custo para serem construídas e aprimoradas e, ao chegar no último nível, o jogador pode escolher, se permitido na fase, escolher entre um dos dois últimos níveis de aprimoração. Há também o caso de haver torres de [i]mercenários[/i] nas fases, que são diferentes dependendo do contexto dela (como, por exemplo, fases que se passam na praia possuem torres de [i]piratas[/i]; dependendo da fase, pode ser que haja, além dos inimigos que percorrem os caminhos, ajuda ([i]jawas[/i] que atiram nos inimigos) ou desafios ao jogador ([i]plantas carnívoras[/i] que podem comer seus [i]soldados[/i] e inimigos).

As torres de [i]arqueiros[/i], [i]artilharia[/i] e [i]magia[/i] possuem um alcance definido que pode ser aumentado com aprimorações de seus níveis ou de aprimorações especiais, que podem ser habilitadas chegando ao último nível. Já a torre de [i]soldados[/i] funciona de forma diferente, criando soldados que são constantemente fornecidos (ao máximo de 3) e que podem ser postos em um determinado ponto do caminho, dependendo do alcance fornecido; esses soldados lutarão contra os inimigos terrestres, bloqueando pelo menos 1 inimigo por cada soldado vivo (se houver apenas 1 inimigo, todos os soldados vivos o atacarão, se houver 4 inimigos vivos, 3 serão bloqueados enquanto o outro continuará o caminho).

Ademais, cada torre possui um tipo de dano que realiza. As torres de [i]arqueiros[/i], [i]soldados[/i] e [i]artilharia[/i] realizam basicamente dano físico, enquanto a torre de [i]magia[/i] realiza basicamente dano mágico. A decisão de que tipo de torres construir depende muito de que tipo de inimigos estão atacando em cada caminho na fase; se em um caminho há muitos inimigos com armadura física, a melhor forma de atacá-los é com torres de [i]magia[/i], assim como se há muitos inimigos com armadura mágica, a melhor forma de atacá-los é com torres de [i]arqueiros[/i], [i]soldados[/i] e [i]artilharia[/i]. Esse é um dos elementos de estratégia em [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b].

O jogo também apresenta heróis, que são habilitados conforme o jogador progrede no jogo: cada herói possui ataque básico, físico ou mágico, e 5 habilidades (ativas ou passivas) que podem ser habilitadas e aprimoradas conforme esses ganham níveis (os heróis ganham níveis derrotando inimigos em uma fase). Os heróis também bloqueiam inimigos e podem ajudar suas torres a derrotar inimigos dessa forma. É possível apenas escolher um herói por fase, logo, saber qual herói utilizar em determinada fase é outro elemento de estratégia do jogo.

Por fim, o jogador possui duas habilidades especiais: a [i]chuva de fogo[/i] e os [i]reforços[/i]. A [i]chuva de fogo[/i] é uma carta na manga que normalmente deve ser utilizada para derrotar grupos grandes de inimigos que poderão colocar em risco sua situação em uma fase; já os [i]reforços[/i] são uma opção para bloquear inimigos para que suas torres ou heróis os derrotem. Cada uma dessas habilidades possui um tempo de recarga diferente.

[b]Progresso[/b]
O progresso no jogo se dá principalmente pela conclusão impecável de cada fase; ao concluir uma fase, você é recompensado por estrelas, que podem ser gastas numa árvore de bônus para suas torres e habilidades especiais, que pode ser apagada a qualquer momento sem qualquer prejuízo. É possível conseguir até 3 estrelas por concluir uma fase, e, após concluí-la, você possui a chance de completar os desafios [i]de ferro[/i] e [i]heroico[/i] para conseguir uma estrela em cada um.

O desafio [i]heroico[/i] consiste em defender-se de 6 grandes ondas de inimigos com apenas um ponto de vida. Já o desafio [i]de ferro[/i] consiste em defender-se contra uma grande onda constante de inimigos com apenas um ponto de vida, logo, não há muito tempo para calcular meticulosamente a estratégia, forçando o jogador a agir rapidamente contra a onda de inimigos.

Ao completar as 15 fases, o jogador completa o cenário de [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] e assiste ao fim da história do jogo.

[b]Veredito[/b]
Por [i]R$ 19,99[/i], [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] é um jogo que se diferencia dos tradicionais jogos do gênero e que possui um alto nível de desafio e fornece ao jogador um valor de poder jogar novamente determinadas fases, já que cada uma delas é única. Talvez não possa valer, no momento, o que custa, uma vez que é possível jogar a versão [i]flash[/i] gratuitamente. [b]Mas[/b], assim como Kingdom Rush, [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] receberá as fases adicionais gratuitamente, o que justificará o seu custo.

Mesmo sendo um jogo originalmente [i]flash[/i], o jogo possui um estilo audiovisual incrível, com detalhes em todos os lugares e indivíduos, impecáveis vozes às torres e heróis (com diversas referências), e uma trilha sonora muito boa. Além disso, o jogador possui, nesta versão, a escolha de uma variedade de resoluções diferentes, a opção de colocar os gráficos em [i]Full HD[/i] e de escolher se quer rodar o jogo em 30 ou 60 [i]fps[/i].

[b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] também se diferencia de seu predecessor por ter diferentes últimos níveis para todas as torres, heróis, inimigos e, principalmente, fases. Para jogadores de Kingdom Rush, [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] será uma agradável sequência.

E desafio não falta ao jogo. [b]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/b] possui três níveis de dificuldade; o nível mais difícil é realmente um desafio para qualquer jogador do gênero.

24908070.review:
Love this game. Bought it as soon as it went on sale on Steam (I already have KR, and plan to get Origins, completed KR on Steam and on Android and played flash variant too).

The game is well drawn (actually, a little too cute for such a bloody mess xD ), sounds are nice and levels are well designed. Some levels on "Veteran" difficulty seem a bit brutal till you figure out how you're supposed to fight.

Completed it all on Veteran difficulty, with Heroic and Iron challenges. Loved the difficulty - some levels are puzzling and brutal, although none are impossible, you just have to figure out how to do it.
Loved Heroic challenges, some were rather hard. Iron was a little disappointing, I remember there being one tough level, others were a breeze after beating Heroic (it comes sooner in the list). Flexibility of this game (ability to change skills for heroes and upgrades for towers) allows you to adapt your upgrades to any challenge, any level, any strategy. And its wonderful.

Can't wait for updates with new levels.

第一次写评测，很高兴献给我最爱的塔防游戏系列， kingdom rush。
毫无疑问kingdom rush是当下最优秀的塔防游戏之一（可能没有之一）。相比起iOS版，更大的地图，更加精美的画风，随着关卡解锁而无需二次付费的英雄，都让人感到满满的诚意。使用火雨的时候有区域提示，这点比起iOS版更人性化。取消了钻石系统而无法购买道具进行”作弊“，也更加考验玩家的水平和操作，整体更加耐玩，需要更加细致的布局。
对于游戏本身，相比前作，英雄等级不再清零无疑是要给好评的。前作中火人正因为其快速的升级速度获得了我的青睐。而在本作中，无疑更看重英雄本身的能力，技能等指标。在前期星星较少，科技发展一般要给援兵和火雨，同时兵营不如一代圣骑的情况下，沙王Arlic作为一个自带兵营的英雄，常常是我优先选择的。希望能尽早更新，放出更多英雄，尤其是我最爱的骨龙Bonehart，以及女巫Bruxa。
最后说一点小小的心得：地震塔的岩浆技能个人认为非常有价值，真实伤害可用于有效应对带甲单位，经计算，升满后攻击力约等于翻倍，强烈建议使用。l

24741009.review:
'Kingdom Rush Frontiers' is the second game of the 'Kingdom Rush' tower defence game series. Like it's predecessor it's a port from iOS and Android but that does not diminish the quality of the game. It's a very enjoyable, colourful, comic style, strategy game that's not to be missed if you like tower defence games.

Pros:
- cute comic style
- traditional path-based tower defence game 
- loads of pop-culture references to films like Star Wars, Indiana Jones, Castaway, Predator etc.
- maps can change in the middle of the action when enemies create new paths
- challenging
- cool boss enemies that can make your whole defence setup worthless
- three difficulty levels plus Iron and Heroic difficulty with completely different waves of enemies
- more than 40 types of enemies
- complex combination of towers with different special abilities
- special attacks
- nine different heroes with very different special abilities
- looks and plays like the original - yes, that's a good thing
- addictive
- maps contain secrets
- upgradeable towers base values
- upgradeable heroes base values
- no glitches, no bugs

Cons:
- absolutely none

1.兵营用处不大，虚区不高并且容易被远程怪爆菊，最大的作用就是阻挡兵线了。兵营有两个升级路线，一个是刺客一个是骑士，个人更偏向升级骑士，因为比较耐艹23333
2.魔法塔两条升级路线中骷髅塔完全可以取代兵营的位置，并且还召唤小兵数量远超兵营，还附带AOE和强大的亡灵骑士，非常推荐和炮塔的地震塔放在一起堵路口。魔法塔另一个升级路线好像是法师塔吧？我一般都是造在最后面升级龙卷风防止漏怪，另外攒三个球爆发还是很高的，因为攻速慢的关系不适合放在最前线
3.炮塔威武，不论是地震塔还是高达，两条升级路线都超级赞。地震塔非常适合放在攻击范围大并且是必经之路的路口，尤其是升级了熔岩之后AOE虚区简直爆炸，升级突破天际的钻头之后也能很好的弥补面对高血量怪物的乏力，可惜就是科技升级偏贵。高达可以像兵营一样选择移动位置，不过不能起到阻挡兵线的作用，高达可以学习导弹和地沟油，地沟油会提供高额的减速效果，导弹是非常强力的全图虚区手段，并且可以对地对空，配合上其全图虚区的攻击范围对空虚区完全不虚魔法塔和箭塔    另外炮塔天赋点满会有几率晕眩敌人，配合地震塔的减速效果拔群
4.箭塔    箭塔的高攻速配合天赋的二连射在持续输出方面高的可怕，尤其是箭塔的弩箭塔科技升级了连射之后，基本一套下来boss都扛不住，另外弩箭塔还可以为周围炮塔提供攻速加成，这个的等级提升好像只会增加影响范围，一般来说学一级就够。箭塔另外一个科技是跳大神塔，嗯，对没错，一定是这个名字。这塔攻击力虽然比弩箭塔高但是攻速太低因而虚区并不高，不过可以跟萨满学习摇很多图腾出去，可以为其他塔提供很高的虚区，因此在中后期推荐造一个
5.英雄   英雄在本作作用还是非常巨大的，包括前期承担出力输出位，中后期各种满地图查缺补漏，有时候还有各种地图事件要应付，总之就是一个存在感非常强移动范围非常广的人形自走防御塔啦。每个英雄都有各自的特点，包括有的能对空有的不能对空。感觉上牧师的作用最小，因为很少会有人把兵营当成主要防御手段吧。。。。海盗可以让在自己周围被杀死的小怪提供额外的金钱，可以贪非常多的钱只是这货比较脆并且虚区不高    石头人有很高的AOE虚区可惜不能对空    法爷是我最喜欢的英雄，可以全图瞬移，虚区不凡，平A附带弹弹乐效果，还有消失技能可以用来补刀，平时放一下烟花就算虚区不高不过画面效果还是不错的，虽然会被很多魔法抵抗的怪克制23333另外法爷最魔性的就是瞬移的时候会喊一句：boom沙卡拉卡    hhhhhhh超魔性对吧

24721731.review:
[h1]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/h1]
[i](Scroll down for a tl;dr version.)[/i]

I simply loved "Kingdom Rush", for me it was one of the best tower defense games I've ever played. Therefore, I was no question whether I'd buy its sequel "Kingdom Rush Frontiers" immediately.
In the following I will consider some of the, in my opinion, key aspects of the game in detail.


Gameplay:
First, let me sum up the basics of the game: There are 4 types of towers, with 2 final branches each. There is a total of 15 levels, divided into 3 different regions with different types of enemies respectively. Each level has a "Heroic" and an "Iron" version that will unlock after the level was completed with perfect 3 stars. There are many different heroes that you can level up. Moreover you can also level up your powers and abilities with perks. That means you cannot only gear up your towers during a level but also globally.
All in all, the different towers, abilities and heroes form a unique gameplay. Especially the abilities and the heroes are features that I missed in so many other TD games, and that make this game so great, in my opinion.

Graphics:
The graphics of this game simply look gorgeous. Every pixel looks like it was handcrafted affectionately.

The price with respect to the content:
10 bucks for initially 15 levels and ~20 hours of fun; sounds okay to me (note: I think that I completed the game quickly). But wait, there's more: Shortly after the release of the game the devs announced 3 free content updates that all game owners will receive. Thanks for that!

Difficulty:
The difficulty of the game is a pro and a con at the same time. The beginning was not too easy, some of the levels took me some tries till I was able to master them.
But after I unlocked the second branch of the mortar tower, the mech, this changed instantly. I was able to completed all the following levels very very quickly and also most of them in the first try. I think the mech is simply overpowered.
In contrast, the game offers to change the difficulty, so this issue could be fixed easily, I guess. Still I am satisfied with the difficulty because it took me some time to figure out a good setup for each of the "Heroic" and "Iron" versions.


[b] Summary - Pros (+) and Cons (-):[/b]
    + gameplay
    + graphics
    + price w.r.t. content
    o difficulty


[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
For me "Kingdom Rush" is now one of the best tower defense series I've every played. "Kingdom Rush Frontiers" is a great sequel; if you liked the first one, you will for sure also like this one. The devs basically did not change much in the already great concept, rather added new levels, enemies and towers.

24720055.review:
很难找到比皇家守卫系列更好的塔防游戏了
最高难度全满血通关后来评论一下，感觉难度的确不低。相比于上一作品，塔的特性变化不小。
下面说一些通关后的感觉：

1、兵营还是和上一代一样战斗力不是特别强。大多数情况下就是拦截的作用，输出相对其他塔来说并不高。虽然升级后战斗力客观，但是太耗钱了（毕竟兵营有3个升级选项）。所以我最高难度通关下来，大多数关卡兵营用的都不多，而且等级也不需要升多少，仅仅是拦截作用。但是值得一提的是有些关卡兵营有奇效，比如会召唤木乃伊的、操纵僵尸的，这些类似于“母体”的怪可以调小兵去在“召唤”开始之前就拦下来干掉（我是用刺客完成的，感觉3个刺客冲上去干BOSS的这种事情还有点帅呢）。

2、强烈推荐机枪塔和高达。机枪塔输出爆炸而且耗钱相对少，还可以给周围的塔加buff。高达输出也很可观，导弹可以支援对空作战，并且可以像兵营一样选择地点，灵活性很高。

3、魔法塔竟然可以当兵营用！骷髅塔的骷髅兵用来代替兵营是个不错的选择。

4、为了强行提高难度我只用第二个英雄去打通关，其他的英雄并没有尝试过。这一作英雄还是非常关键的，经常需要英雄来提供输出（至少我是这么打的）。
11/10
强烈推荐

24711317.review:
As far as tower defense games go, Kingdom Rush Frontiers is as solid as they come. Adorable, vibrant fantasy graphics and animations, tons of content and replay value, and fantastic sound and music. The tower upgrade paths, the wide variety of heroes to choose from, and the global perk tree made for some wonderful strategic combinations and unique gameplay not normally found in your average tower defense game.

I had a great time experimenting with hero and tower combos. Using the pirate with his ability to call upon the Kraken and having it lock enemies in place while my towers mowed them down was among my favourite combos, and there are countless others to try and discover.

Units are fully voiced in the game, and while it can sometimes get repetitive hearing the same lines over and over, the voice acting was well done and fit the overall cartoon, humerous theme perfectly.

Get those towers up, ready your hero, because at the current price of $10.99 CAD and with more FREE content coming, Kingdom Rush Frontiers is not one you should let slip by.

My full review: http://discoverplayshare.com/review/calling-all-defenders-linirea-needs-you/

24690295.review:
Alright, I shoulda jumped on the bandwagon ever since this game's release on Steam, but I wanted to make sure it's just how I remembered it to be.
AND IT IS!!!
Now THIS means good trust in a company to not fuck up a mobile port!

Review:
[*]Whatca need to know about Frontiers? It's the second game in the Kingdom Rush trilogy, and also the second one to hit Steam, and it is a tower defense game, esentially.

[*]The concept of gameplay and story is pretty simple: evil guy wants to rule land hurr durr, build towers to spook them, then go after the bad guy yourself and defeat him. And you know? It isn't called Kingdom Rush for nothing, I mean your kingdom is under attack of another kingdom, you defend succesfully and just go after the enemy's ass. You're [i]rushing[/i] your [i]kingdom[/i] into his face! As much as it sounds like fun, well, it is!

[*]Now the gameplay itself consists of you defending a couple of pathways from enemies to reach your booty and you have to build specialty towers for that. There are a total of 4 towers to construct and each one has 3 normal upgrades and 2 branching ones, which change their gameplay all-together or are just straight upgrades to the normal towers, which both options are still nice. Apart from the towers, you also get to choose a hero to help you out in your journey, and you unlock more as you play, and what can I say other than that they all have unique properties and abilities and I'll leave the magic of discovering for yourself ;)

[*]Now as of the game's release there is only the campaign available to be played and there are only half the heroes available compared to the mobile version, HOWEVER, all of the remaining special levels as well as the heroes are going to be updated a tad bit later and everything will be perfectly fine, as believe me, all of that content is worth your while.
[b]bUT mr. ReVIeWeR, hoW CAn YoU be So surE tHey wiLL aDd thEm?!?[/b]
It's simple: proof of Kingdom Rush 1. At launch, not everything was available right away, however in a couple of good working months, all that was promised, as well as its own Steam exclusive levels were added in updates and everyone lived happily ever after. Except for Veznan lol

[*]Now for the levels themself have been improved quite a bit since its predecessor, and pretty much a vast majority of 'em have special encounters you have to keep an eye on, some being fun, some being challenging and a lot being annoying :)

[*]And lastly, 2 more things before Imma go finish the last heroic level: the soundtrack is just as epic as you expect it to be, that's one. Two: each enemy and unit has it's own character portrait, but the towers do not anymore. That made me quite sad, since the ones in the original KR kicked ass!

tl;dr Welp, it delivers what you expect: a solid tower defense game. Now I am not a fan of strategy games at all, but I do recommend this game for anyone, regardless of preferences, as it's just simple to learn and understand and it's just that addictingly good. The final verdict for Kingdom Rush Frontiers as of it's release is a well worthy 9/10. If you're willing to go get this game when all of the levels and heroes have been pushed out, well let me tell you(and this will skip me an edit in the future, trust me) that your game is worth a 10/10! But why a perfect rating? It improves on everything that the original game had, which is strategy and imagination, with more creative towers, more creative enemies and heroes alike as well as the levels.

This has been your random reviewer, leaving his opinion and going. The choice of purchase is all up to you. Have a nice day!

Final note edit: Did you know there's a toilet paper emoticon from this game? Now that's true devotion to emoticons! :krtp:

24684668.review:
I'm gonna hop on the review train relatively early.

Bought the first game released for steam and recieved about a week ago a coupon for 25% off on this game. Fairly certain that was the devs that requested that, so you know <3 Ironhide, they respect their fanbase. Even without the coupon, if you've played the first game, you'll love this one.

They've upped the strategy, and made heroes more than just a point and click go here and stand your ground. Control upgrade points as they level up. Heroes keep their levels after battle but it takes a significantly larger amount of time to level them up, levels are unique to each hero. Hero A at level 7? Well, Hero B is at level 3, go grind some earlier levels to level that guy up. Distribute level up points into unique skills for each hero.

Towers have been changed/tweaked, new upgrade paths and gimmicks (the Archery Tower's final upgrades are actually useful now), further you go up certain tower, the more synergy you get with other towers around it, Archery tower for example, has a side path upgrade in one of the level 4 upgrades that effects all towers around it with increase range (has to be a mage, another archery, or bombard tower), also gives chance for criticals to all those towers. Smack an archery tower in the middle of the group and spam the upgrades, watch as your Mages get blown-out-of-the-water range on their attacks.

No new towers though, I'd have hoped for a 5th choice, not just the original four you get in the first game. Oh, new map by the way, and of course it's very pretty.

New Environments, new enemies, same great feel.

My experience this far is that the levels are a lot more close to challenging than they were in the first game, where it was either too easy or too hard. I feel like if I just tweak my strategy in someway with my tower setup/troop positioning/upgrade purchases I'll be successful. A feeling I haven't got with any game since I played Halo: Reach Legendary Difficulty.

8/10, hopefully the next one they step it up a bit more, but definitely a worthy sequel and well worth the money.

BUY IT
BUY IT
BUT IT
GET YOUR WALLET
AND BUY THIS GAME

[h1] 或许是目前世界上最好玩的塔防游戏 [spoiler]没有之一[/spoiler] [/h1]
剑与魔法的世界还包含着各种乱七八糟稀奇古怪的东西，跟前作不同的是本作的所有进阶建筑全部都变了，真的诚意十足，英雄系统也是很优秀，而且还保留了前作的各种梗[spoiler]【法爷真是强】[/spoiler]。

讲到玩梗，这个系列可以说是我见过玩梗玩到最丧心病狂的，不管是阿瓦达索命咒还是bong沙卡拉卡~而且彩蛋更是精彩到想不到，[spoiler]抓美人鱼，瓶中信，蛤蛤，救公主等等[/spoiler]都是十分有趣，而且还有对应成就。

说到价格，这个游戏只能用物超所值来形容了，还有集换式卡牌可以爆，徽章也很可爱你值得拥有，而且所有内购项目全部一次买全，后续更新好像也都是免费的了，简直良心到爆炸。

作为一款续作完全没有落入俗套，保持了优秀品质的同时还有小革新。

10/10

三、四年前在armorgames上玩到了Kingdom Rush和KF Frontiers，当时觉得塔防游戏竟然也能这么有趣，能用上这么多的电影梗，所以非常喜欢这系列的游戏，可惜无奈的是当时没有国际信用卡，也不会用paypal，再加上内购价格当时还是觉得舍不得，所以没能支持。

近几年手机游戏大爆发，KR系列也上了手机平台，可惜买不起iphone，而中国大陆用安卓上google play也十分不便，于是又一次没能支持一下Ironhide的好游戏。

现在，steam版上线了，该是支持一下好游戏和好制作公司的时候了。

=======

KR这个塔防游戏系列向来是简单易上手的，通过在沿路的各建造点建造四类防御塔——兵营，负责提供地面单位来阻挡地面敌人的前进；弓箭塔，通过频率高但伤害不高的远程单体物理来对低护甲的敌人进行阻击和快速削弱；魔法塔，提供攻击低频率但高伤害的单体魔法攻击，适合对付物防高移动慢且血较多的敌人；炸药/炮塔，提供攻击频率低但伤害较高的范围物理伤害，能够快速扫平聚集在一起前进的多个脆弱敌人——来尝试阻止敌人对我方城镇的破坏。

虽然上手容易，但随着游戏进程的推进，你会发现游戏越来越考验你对于四种防御塔以及地图路线和建造点的熟悉程度，或许这一关需要大量排放炮塔来扫平海量的杂兵，又或许这一关出兵不多但血量感人，需要安排魔法塔或炮塔定向清除，一切都需要你自行摸索。

游戏内可以对各种防御塔的能力进行升级，比如增加攻击范围，比如增加伤害，又比如强化特殊能力，这一切都需要借助你攻下某一关卡后获得的评定星级的星星来解锁，你玩得越好，能够解锁的能力越多。但是，并不是只要堆大量的能力就能轻易地获得更多的星星。因为游戏关卡除了基本模式外，同一关卡还有英雄模式和铁拳模式，进入这两种模式后是会限制你能够解锁的能力等级上限。比如说魔法塔的1级能力是增加攻击范围，二级能力是增加伤害，而当前关卡的英雄和铁拳模式限制能力最高为一级，那即便你解锁到了魔法塔的第二级能力，在这一关中也只能激活第一级的能力。而相比英雄模式，更困难的铁拳模式还会限制你可以使用的防御塔种类。如果再考虑到英雄模式和铁拳模式会改变每一波敌人的数量以及配置，会更加考验你对于游戏的理解能力，那么说KR系列也是难以精通的。

希望这几句无聊的话没有打消你想要尝试一下的想法，毕竟要体会到一款游戏的魅力所在主要还是得通过自己的眼睛和双手来亲自玩一下的，不是吗？ :D

24636786.review:
[h1]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/h1] Evaluation en francais & English review under the french one

Le nouveau tower defense de chez Ironhide studio arrive enfin sur nos PC
Tout comme son prédécésseur Kingdom rush frontiers (KDF pour les intimes)
Le joueur doit résister à une série de vagues enemies à l'aide d'un héros et de 4 types d'unités
(sans compter l'unité de renforcement) et de pouvoirs "magiques".
Votre héros ainsi que vos unités disposent d'un arbre de compétences qui évoluera plus ou moins rapidement
en fonction de votre classement dans les différents niveaux.
Chaque niveau dispose de trois modes: Campaign, Heroic et Iron.

[h1]Les combats:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][i]Archer Tower[/i]
    [*][i]Milita Barracks[/i]
    [*][i]Mage Tower[/i]
    [*][i]Dwarven Bombard[/i]
[/list]
Chaque unité dispose de deux spécialisations.
Chaque héros est spécialisé pour le corps-à-corps ou à distance et dispose de plusieurs "sorts/compétences"
Vous devrez choisir judicieusement votre héros et vos spécialisations de tours en fonction de chaque niveau.

[h1]Pros.[/h1]
Très Fun
Bourré d'humour
Addictif
Forte rejouabilité
Pas de microtransactions

[h1]Cons.[/h1]
Je cherche encore...

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[h1]18/20[/h1]
Kingdom rush frontier est un exellent tower defense tout comme son ainé !
Bourré à craquer d'easter egg et d'événements interactifs, on ne s'ennuie jamais.
N'hésitez pas une seconde et foncez !

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

[h1]Kingdom Rush Frontiers[/h1]

The new tower defense from Ironhide studio finally arrives on our PC
Just like his predecessor Kingdom rush frontiers (KDF for the close friends)
The player has to resist a series of enemies waves with the help of a hero, 4 types of units and "magic" powers.
Your hero and your units as well have a skilltree which will evolve more or less quickly according to your rank in the various levels.
Every level has three modes: Campaign, Heroic and Iron.

[h1]Fighting:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][i]Archer Tower[/i]
    [*][i]Milita Barracks[/i]
    [*][i]Mage Tower[/i]
    [*][i]Dwarven Bombard[/i]
[/list]
Each unit has two specializations
Each hero specializes in close or range combat and has several "spells/skills"
You will need to wisely choose your hero and your specializations for every levels.

[h1]Pros.[/h1]
very Fun
Full of jokes
Addictive
high replayability
No microtransactions

[h1]Cons.[/h1]
I am still searching...

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
[h1]18/20[/h1]
Kingdom Rush frontier is an exellent tower defense like his predecessor !
Contain an amazing quantity of easter egg and interactive events, you'll never get bored with this game.
What are you looking for? go for it now :)

24630904.review:
Did you like Kingdom Rush? Do you want more Kingdom Rush? This is it - more Kingdom Rush. It's not quite as good as the original but it's nice to have it on PC anyway, it's still good fun.

What I like:
 - pretty much everything good about the original is still here more or less. It looks great, plays fast and is fun.
 - new towers, enemies, heroes and environments.
 - most stages have some unique stuff. New paths being created mid-stage, neutral creatures eating both enemies and your soldiers, stealing gold from a dragon etc.

What I don't like:
 - cave levels are (in my experience) much easier than desert and jungle levels. I played on veteran and I breezed through them while I struggled with some challenges in the earlier stages.
 - bosses are really, really weak.
 - this new hero leveling system is weird, it promotes grinding and makes the difficulty curve out of whack. I don't like it.
 - level 4 specialist towers from the original are nowhere to be found.
 - necromancer tower is overpowered.
 - it's shorter than the original. There are more stages coming in future updates though.
 - "tap to..." don't do that. I know it's a port but this is PC.

24614406.review:
Kolejna odsłona gry z serii Kingdom Rush, która w końcu zawitała na Steama. Wersja Frontiers tym razem zabiera nas na południowy wschód od poprzedniej części gdzie czekają na nas suche pustynie, gęsta dżungla czy monumentalne jaskinie.
Wraz ze zmianą otoczenia zmienia nam się również arsenał, po którego ulepszeniu można wymienić gildie assassin'ów, wieżę potężnego arcymaga, fort kuszniczy oraz 3 inne drogi rozwoju. Oprócz samych konstrukcji do zbudowania posiadamy do dyspozycji mocarnych herosów poczynając od początkowo poznanego champion'a Alrica kończąc na smoku Ashbite.
Należy dodać iż herosi posiadają swój poziom, statystyki oraz  umiejętności, które rozwijają podczas udziału w walce.
Rozwijać przyjdzie nam nie tylko naszych bohaterów, ale i same wieże obronne poprzez wykupywanie ulepszeń, które tyczą się również naszych czarów jak wezwanie posiłków oraz armagedon. Ulepszenia wież wykupujemy za gwiazdki, które uzyskujemy kończąc to kolejne misje. 
Gra jest tower defense'm więc nasz cel towarzyszący przez całą rozgrywke jest oczywisty i prosty, lecz tylko na pierwszy rzut oka. Do  wyboru mamy 3 klasyczne poziomy trudności a do ukończenia czeka na nas kampania oraz misje poboczne gdzie każdą pojedyńczą misję mozemy ukonczyć na 3 różnych wariantach. Do walki przyjdzie nam się mierzyć z całą masą różnorodnych przeciwników zaczynając od hordy pustynnych zbirów po dzikich mieszkańców dżungli i wiele wiecej. 
Oczywiście nie mogły nas ominąć epickie walki z wszechmocnymi bossami zamieszkującymi krainę. Jeśli chodzi o grafikę, animacje oraz muzykę wiele się nie zmieniło od pierwszej części co można uznać za szczyt perfekcji. Już po rozpoczęciu gry widzimy żywą mapę krainy przepełnioną kolorami, a także szczegółami. Kreska jest bardzo przyjemna dla oczu wraz z ciekawymi animacjami postaci czy obiektów. Soundtrack również nie pozostaje niczym innym jak miodem dla uszu.
Wersja Steam'owa gry oferuje dodatkowo połączoną masę satysfakcjonujących osiągnięć, karty kolekcjonerskie oraz chmurę dzięki, której możecie być spokojni o zapis gry. W dniu kiedy piszę recenzję gra na platformie jest świeża i czeka ją masa aktualizacji wnoszących min. dodatkowe misje poboczne, nowych bohaterów i poprawki ogólne. 
Moja ocena końcowa jest taka sama jak na pierwszej odsłonie Steam'owego Kingdom Rush'a, czyli oczywiście tytuł obowiązkowy dla każdego fana gier typu Tower Defense. Produkcja wciągnie na najbardziej grywalne godziny rozgrywki dając głębokie wrażenia. Dla mnie seria króluje na czele gier strategicznych tego typu. Nic dodać, nic ująć.

More of the same, but at the same time it's slightly different(not to mention that "more of the same" means "more good stuff"). The difficulty level is just right on veteran mode, where you need to try quite hard, but you still know it's possible even if you fail a couple dozen times. The added micro-management needed to complete some of the veteran stages is very nice and unique for a tower defence as well.

I'm looking forward to the port of the next game in Kingdom Rush. The developers have done a good job porting it over from mobile twice now. Well worth the asking price.

After reading Ironhide Studio's blog about not bringing Kingdom Rush: Origins to PC, the last thing I ever expected to see when I opened up Steam was a coupon for another Kingdom Rush game - and yet here it is! Having just finished the campaign, I can say that this was a worthy sequal to the original Kingdom Rush. The maps got progressively harder, but not impossibly so, and the new upgrade towers were quite fun to experiment with. I love tower defense games, and KR: Frontiers checks all the boxes - difficult, fun, and good to look at.

我的经历就是到了理工附中到了高三刚开始的时候，我在想我估计也快要高考了。我想我应该去玩游戏，于是我就给G胖，Steam客服向他们申请了个账号，他们说欢迎你来，不过这个Steam wallet你要往里面充钱的。我就充了50块买了个KingdomRush。这KingdomRush经过好几百个同学一致通过。那么通过以后我就买第二个游戏，BloonsTD5，这两个游戏买了以后不久（其实过了好久~~~~~），过后2016年的7月25日KingdomRushFrontiers就出了。现在这个游戏买了也快3天了，所以今天呢，我就在这里写篇评测。就是呼应我之前写的KingdomRush的评测的。

人呐就都不知道，自己就不可以预料。你一个游戏买不买啊，当然要靠自我剁手，但是也要考虑钱包的感觉，我绝对不知道，我作为一个高三学生怎么让我玩到皇家守卫军去了，所以G胖同志跟我讲话，说“Ironhide都决定啦，KingdomRush出新作啦！”，我说另请高明吧。我实在我也不是谦虚，我一个高三学生怎么就能玩游戏呢？但是呢，G胖同志讲“大家已经研究决定了”，所以后来我就念了两首(原话如此)诗，叫“苟利皇家生死以，岂因没钱避趋之”，那麼所以我就买了这个新作品。

24572977.review:
Для читателя неискушенного, не слышевшего прежде про конфликт поколений, отцов и детей, дедов и внуков, деверей и крестных, "шотландцев других шотландцев" (с), сначала просьба пройти [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Rorsha/recommended/246420/]сюда.[/url]

ААаааа, внучара, хвост ты пёсий, ты чего мне в слабительное добавил! Аааа, штож меня кроет то так, ужас какой. Привиделось мне, что внук у меня нормальный, а не то что... а ладно, тщетно все это описывать. И привиделось ещё, что Kingdom Rush Frontiers в Стим выпустили. Через три года после релиза на флеше. Хм, неторопливые эти ребята из Ironehide. А, чо, правда выпустили?! Теребеть твою кочерыжку... ээээээЭээ, стой, это не призыв к действию!.. это выражение такое. Ты знаешь что такое "выражение"? Ты кстати, кто у нас нынче? Раньше был сетевым продавцом, а щас? Чо, хипстер-веган-вейпер? Теребить твою....эээээЭэ, стой! хватит уже... И что эти три фигни значат? Не отвечай, вопрос риторический, не хочу знать.

Значится Kingdom Rush Frontiers. Он такой же как и просто Kingdom Rush, только Frontiers. Т.е. в этой штуке жанра "Тавер дефенс" делать придётся все то же самое - строя канопульки вдоль дорог, не дать пройти супостатам к точке G... точке Х... кароче за флажки... блин, все равно непонятно. Кароче просто не дать им пройти до конца дороги, а то сдохнешь совсем. Во. Ресурсы все те же - башни с шарами магическими, стрелами вострыми, бомбы с напалмом и отряды суицидников. Ну и там заклинания в виде призыва призывников призывного возраста через призывную комиссию. Что? Нет, точно для призыва, я не ошибаюсь. И заклинание "Огненный дожжжь". Да, просто, без описания - "Огненный дожжжь". Оно настолько крутО, что описание ему не нужно. Только теперь все эти башенки-ресурсы называются и выглядят по другому. Я модное слов знаю, "Ребрендинг", во. Аха, как и у Почты России. Этикетка другая, старухи в очередях те же. И марку все равно лизать приходится. 

И был бы это наверное просто ещё один набор дополнительных 15-ти миссий к основной игре, если бы авторы  не добавили спецэффектов и анимаций во время боя. Теперь сражения в финальной часте каждой миссии в игре напоминает... ну, представь себе полный симфонический оркестр из двухсот рыл. Но играют на инструментах цыгане. Шум, ор, гвалт, грохот, звон, дребезжание. Но ноги сами просятся в пляс, настолько это зажигательно.  Ну представь себе теперь визуально, все нарисовано в ярком мультяшном стиле, и одноврменно анимируется: по-разному нарисованные воины десяти видов машут мечами, во все стороны летают стрелы, запускаются магические шары всех цветов и расцветок, из земли поднимается нежить, пираты с корабля палят из пушек, призванные звери носятся туда-сюда по экрану, гномы бросаются пивом, гигантские черви вылезают из земли (что в твоей Дюне), драконы палыхают сверху огнём, гигантские растения пожирают воинов, с неба сыплется "Огненный дожжжь", обезьяны бросаются бананами, пауки и гигантские осы откладывают яйца, гигантский Кинг-Конг делает поступательные движения тазом в сторону  Эмпайер Стейт Билдинг, Доктор Манхеттен кончает углекислотой прямо в экран, Древнее Зло ржёт и рождается на осколках мироздания.  И все это одновременно на экране.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=732941303

У меня видеокарта сгорела от попытки отрисовать все это одновремнно. А нет, вру. Это она от того, что я пытался ролик Ютюб запустить в ленте активности Стим.

Отличная вторая часть и без того совершенной игры теперь и в Стим. Лучше поздно чем никогда. Хотя я бы предпочел нормального внука, а не хипстера-вегана-вейпера. Что бы эта фигня ни значила.

24571608.review:
Updating my review. I played both the mobile and flash version of this game and both are great but this version takes the cake.

Pros:
- Beautiful and stylish art
- All heroes are free! 
- Easy to learn
- References (lots of them)
- 60 FPS Full HD
- Free expansions every month! 
- Mech tower. No seriously, mech towers.

Cons
- No endless mode like from the previous versions
- Parasites (I hate them)

I definitely recommend this game if you're looking for a great tower-defense game. And while you're at it, check the other games in the series as well (Kingdom Rush and Kingdom Rush: Origins).

24571585.review: Excellent game, new heroes, units, harder than the original. Requires much more strategy. If you like tower defense games, you should have this one.

24571344.review:
Kingdom Rush Frontiers is a great Tower Defense. Did you like Kingdom Rush? Then you will love this part too. For me this series is one of the best Tower Defense games for the PC. 

 [*]The graphics are clean and cute. 
 [*]The sound effects and music are perfect 
 [*]The gameplay is just great. You will find long Levels and you have to adapt your strategy. I like the tower, enemy and hero variations and especially the surprises in the levels. The best for me is that it`s not too easy. You really have to find a different strategy to finish each level (you can choose between casual, normal, hard) I think it is obvious that I love this game :)

You will get a lot of play time just with the campaign. And when you are done with that don't forget to try the iron and heroic mode for each level which will give you an extra challenge. For Kingdom Rush I have 80hours + of playtime and for sure I will play both parts again in the future.

Overall,I can only recommend buying this game and trying it out. If you are still not sure whether you will like it, you can watch some gameplay here:  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_GZP0HtO6Go

24565601.review: Это какое-то глобальное обманулово. Во-первых, в компании всего 12 карт... в то время как на айпаде рядом же игра почти двухлетней давности имеет 15 карт капмпании, а затем еще 9 карт открывается после прохождения игры. В ПК-версии почему-то этого не завезли от слова "совсем". Проходится это чудо часа за 4 на среднем уровне и без заморочек, а следовательно к моменту, когда вы понимаете что она кончилась - игру уже не вернуть. Во-вторых, ряд геймплейных моментов отсуствует, нет "гном шопа". Откровенно говоря, ожидал если не большего, то хотя бы уровень игры на айпаде с графикой под ПК. На деле дали только графику и огрызок от первоначальной игры. Если вы, как и я до этого купили все кингдом раши в айтюнсе (коих три на данный момент), то это произведение лучше обойти стороной и продолжаить "долбить" звездочки на айпаде-айфоне.

24565520.review:
Kingdom Rush Frontier é um clássico jogo de "Tower Defense", isto é, você deve posicionar torres em lugares predeterminados que irão impedir que o inimigo ultrapasse um determinado ponto. 
Frontier possui uma continuação da pequena história de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/246420/]Kingdom Rush[/url], que se você já jogou, você vai gostar e vai reparar em alguns aprimoramentos nas jogabilidade, mas se não jogou, vai perceber que o jogo é incrível e inovador!
Semelhante ao antecessor, Frontier possui diversos easters eggs fazendo referências a cultura pop, sejam eles nos cenários ou nos efeitos sonoros - Que junto com a trilha sonora são incríveis. Outro grande ponto positivo são os gráficos que apesar de ser cartunescos reagem bem as diversas ações, desta vez, o jogo possui a opção FullHD.
Kingdom Rush Frontier é uma ótima continuação e um incrível jogo de estratégia e todos que gostam do estilo Tower Defense não irão se decepcionar!

24561588.review:
An absolutely brilliant Tower Defense game.

If you liked the previous game then you will like this one as well. It's simply more of the same with a different setting and different ultimate towers. The upgrades (which you purchase with stars) haven't changed at all, those are all the same. The heroes on the other hand are all new ones, each with their own unique abilities. Newly added to the heroes is a level system. So you don't have to level up your hero while in a match every time over and over. Also new is the enviromental traps (and a few ones that help you as well).

I can only say possitive things about this game. It's highly addictive and lots of fun!

24558582.review:
I couldn't be happier to see one of my all-time favorite Tower Defense games having it's equally amazing sequel FINALLY make it's way to Steam.

The amount of determination this small team has shown, to re-create this game from SCRATCH, to be able to bring it to the Windows platform, shows what kind of devotion Ironhide has towards it's games. And it does show. The same polish and charm the first game had, fully remains.

This sequel has the exact same feel as the original Kingdom Rush; clean and consistant gameplay, yet balanced and challenging. They found a way to completely re-create all 4 tower types with exciting and interesting ability trees. All new enemies with equally interesting abilities, a large array of unique Heroes to choose from, intimidating bosses and ultra challenging bonus levels (and bosses) once the compaign is complete (to be added in an update).

The game and the others in the series are perfect, in my eyes. I couldn't recommend this more, ESPECIALLY if TD is your thing and you like a good challenge (play Veteran:) 

I should note i Beta tested the game, so i may be a bit biased. But of course i'm biased, the game is amazing.

24555406.review:
Als Fan von Kindom Rush freut es mich sehr, daß nach 3 Jahren der Nachfolger es endlich von mobile auch auf den PC geschafft hat. Es ist ein klassiches Tower Defense Spiel, bei dem man auch einen Helden bewegt, der Held kämpft selbstständig.

[u]Türme[/u]
Es gibt dieselben 4 Grundtürme wie früher, die 2x normal upgegradet werden können , beim darauffolgendem Upgrade muß man sich zwischen 2 Spezialisierungen entscheiden.
Die alten Spezialisierungen wurden durch neue ersetzt.

[u]Maps[/u]
Es gibt 15 Maps in der Hauptkamppange und wie im Vorgänger kann nur auf festgelegten Bauplätzen gebaut werden. Die Maps sind abwechslungsreich und auf vielen Maps gibt es Besonderheiten, wie z.B. ein Sandwurm dem man immer wieder ausweichen muß.
Inzwischen wurde das Spiel wie angekündigt von den Entwicklern erweitert, es gibt nun 2 weitere Minikampangen mit jeweils 3 Level, also insgesamt sind es nun 21 Maps.

[u]Gegner[/u]
Es gibt neue Gegner ohne all zu große Überraschungen. Die Gegenerwellen sind sehr gut und abwechslungsreich.

[u]Helden[/u]
Die aktuelle PC-Fassung enthält 13 Helden die man im Laufe der Kampange freischaltet. Helden leveln diesmal nicht nur in einem Kampf, sondern nehmen diese Erfahrung mit in den den nächsten Kampf.

Es gibt 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade, während der Kampange kann beliebig of gewechselt werden.

[u]Fehlerwarnung[/u] (02.11.2016) für alle die Kingdom Rush auf einem zweiten Rechner installieren: Es besteht die große Gefahr, daß die neue Installation nicht die Daten aus der Steam Cloud lädt und sie dann beim Verlassen mit dem neuen Spielstand überschreibt, auch wenn ihr keine Map gespielt habt.

[u]Fazit[/u]
Sehr guter Nachfolger eines sehr guten Spiels. Die bezahlten 7,49€ haben sich gelohnt.

Mehr Empfehlungen (hauptsächlich Tower Defense Spiele):
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8896126-Gametests-and-Videos

24554236.review:
Kingdom Rush Frontiers arrives on Steam at last, and it's a welcome sight!

The original Kingdom Rush is one of the best Tower Defense games out there, and Frontiers works hard to stand out while still being true to the original. The advanced Towers have all changed, which is both a blessing and a curse (no more spamming Tesla Towers for easy wins!), and the enemies have been switched around as well to present you with whole new challenges. You'll face tribal shamans who can make their allies all but impervious to specific damage types, enemies with multiple forms, necromancers galore and all manner of tricky foes that will need smart planning to defeat.

Frontiers feels a lot harder than its predecessor, in no small part due to the need to counter all manner of enemy casters that wander down your lanes. Thankfully, you can always lower the difficulty if things get overwhelming.

If you're new to Tower Defense, try picking up the original Kingdom Rush first. For people who've played that and want more, Frontiers is happy to provide!

24540469.review:
Kingdom Rush Frontiers continues the story that ended in the original. After Vez'nan demise, evil mage Lord Malagar gets his hands on Vez'nan's staff and steals powerful Hammer of Ages. You, unknown hero, have a task to retrieve it before Lord Malagar can use it for his evil plan. That proves to be a difficult job as you are chasing him across the desert, jungle and underground caverns. During your journey, you are gonna encounter new, powerful enemies but you will also get help from (unexpected) allies.  

KRF's gameplay isn't any different from original. There are 15 levels with 3 game modes - Campaign, Heroic and Iron. Also, there are 3 difficulty options - Casual, Normal and Veteran. Completing levels will grant stars that can be spent on upgrading towers and spells. Using Hero during levels will make him more experienced and you can use that experience to make him more powerful.  

Downside of KRF is that there is no checkpoint or fast forward system thus making game a bit tedious on multiple replays but it's balanced by having relatively short levels and plenty of easter eggs.

Fun gameplay, interesting story and upgrade system makes this journey worthwhile of your time.

24538950.review:
I learned to love many Tower Defence Games over the years. The original Kingdom Rush on Armorgames.com was amongst my favorites, thus I did not hesitate to buy its updated version as a fullpriced game on Steam. Seeing this successor made me wonder if the quality could hold up to my expectations; after about an hour of gameplay I have the feeling that I will indeed love this game- as it builds upon the strengths of its predecessor while adding some improvements.
I will first speak about the Kigdom Rush Series as a whole, before getting into detail with Kingdom Rush Frontiers.

[b]What are the strengths of the Kingdom Rush series?[/b]
[i]Style:[/i]First of all the lovely art and sound design; if you are able to bear the sight of a comic look you will notice that the drawings may not be at the peak of 2d-graphics (probably due to the games flash/mobile origins) - but that they do have a decent style on them that makes them distinguishable from other TD-Games. The sound itself is a combination of a decent background music (neither is it outstanding,nor is it irritating) and wonderful catch-phrases by your troops/towers.
[i]Gameplay:[/i] Kingdom Rush is that kind of TD-Game where the path of the enemy units can not be influenced by your towers as you are building them next to the walking-path at specific locations (therefore: no mazes and no towerspamming till the map is full). However, one of the four towers you can build is a "melee-tower" which spawns three soldiers at a location you can can choose within its influence area - this gives you the opportunity to block enemies on the road with a fight - while your towers are tearing them apart. Micromanaging the spawning locations ofthese troops - as well as your powerfull hero character and your two spells - while planning your tower upgrades makes for a pretty intense experience in which you will forget that there is no button for fast-forwarding; as you are much more actively involved into the gameplay as you usually are in a TD-Game.

[b]What improvements does this game bring to the series?[/b]
First and foremost it is the leveldesign that was improved; while the first 6 stages offered a nice variety of artstyle it is the uniqueness of some gameplayelements in those maps, that made them really distinguishable -  without any spoilers: new paths are created and there are more interactive objects than before.
The heroes feel more powerful and unique than in Kingdom Rush.

[b]Is it worth buying?[/b]
That - as always - depends on your experience with Kingdom Rush and TDs in general and of course the price of the game.

If you played Kingdom Rush and liked it you will like this one too. If you like TDs in general but never played Kingdom Rush - give the original a try. If you do not like TDs but are still reading this review I really do question your priorities.

24532337.review:
[h1]Kingdom Rush is the Tower Defense Game [/h1]

Disclaimer: I originally wrote this review for the original Kingdom Rush, but the Frontiers is just more of the good stuff, I add in just bits if they have been improved even more. Easy worth the money. Let's keep it short, shall we?
[list]
    [*]Excellent graphics - beautiful 2d graphics is easy to read, the environments are diverse and reward exploring, just take a look at [url=http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20121022133222/kingdomrushtd/images/9/91/New_Map_Kingdom_Rush.jpg] this beautiful map [/url]. This is the actual in-game map. The difference being that it is animated in game.
    [*]Excellent challenge level - the basic campaign was finished by myself and my wife with equal level of enjoyment. Then the game offered us - with a free update - additional minibosses on the same map. The challenge there spiked and it was precisely what we needed after killing the main baddie.
    [*]Excellent enemy design - regular armored guys, spider queens spawning spiderlings as they go, flying enemies... I could go on, but this would spoil your fun. Go there, prepare your defenses and patch them up in panic mode as something unexpected happens.
    [*]Excellent level design - levels start out linear, only to quickly become mazes with multiple entry points and tunnels. This forced me to rethink my defenses many times. Rarely there is a single chokepoint that one can fortify the hell out of and win the game.
    [*]Excellent tower design - tower upgrades are rewarding. They just are. They look better, pack more punch and do crazy stuff like stealing gold from enemies, transform into Mechs and roam the battlefield.
    [*]Good for all ages - friendly graphics and very user-friendly interface are what makes this game good for different players. You can be a hardcore guy like me, doing all challenges on all levels, or as my wife who plays as much as I but casually. Nobody gets lost in the interface, graphics do not mislead.
    [*]Many save slots - I like the fact that game does not mix saves together. 1st save is mine, 2nd my wife's. We can play the same game and not overwrite our progress.
    [*]Game rewards dedication - finishing a level perfectly gives more upgrade points used to improve your towers. Then there are two additional, optional challenges for each level, totalling to additional 66% of value of the original, perfect score. What I am saying here is: if you buckle down and finish additional challenges then you can upgrade your towers more for the later stages.
I bought this game, I bnought Kingdom Rush: Frontiers as soon as it appeared. This game can
[/list]

24530466.review:
If you liked Kingom Rush, you're going to absolutely [i]love[/i] Frontiers. Everything is retained from the first game, but things have been added to; more heroes (that you can level up and upgrade yourself), new towers, new abilities, and the graphics are simply [i]outstanding[/i]. Each tower got a redesign and everything looks fresh. The startup menu even allows you to choose to play at 30 or 60 FPS if you're into that sort of thing.

For those new to the series, you don't have to have played the first game to enjoy this one, although I'd strongly recommend it as Frontiers feels like a direct sequel. I'd easily claim Kingdom Rush to be one of the best Tower Defense games in the entire genre. The game can be controlled entirely with the mouse, but there are a few optional hotkeys on the keyboard you can use to save yourself the trouble of clicking near the edges of the screen. The in-game hints (that act as a tutorial) as well as the first few levels are [i]very[/i] beginner-friendly and serve as an excellent foundation to get you on your feet. If you're in search of a challenge, however, there's a hard difficulty setting (as well as an easy one if you're having trouble) that you can change to at any time without penalty. Each level also has challenge modes that require not even a single enemy to break through your forces. These challenge modes are completely optional in terms of story progression, but are necessary for 100% completion if you're going for that.

On a sidenote, I got an opportunity to talk with the devs of the game during one of their livestreams; not only do they actively reply to questions and comments, but they're very nice and easygoing and seem more than willing to address any issues, concerns or questions you may have. From what I've experienced, good devs make good games, and Kingdom Rush Frontiers is definitely a game I'm proud of owning in my Steam library.

24522693.review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Kingdom Rush Frontiers handelt es sich um den zweiten auf Steam erschienenen Teil der Kingdom Rush Reihe.
Hierbei handelt es sich um ein Klassisches Tower Defense Spiel das als zusatz noch Helden und Zauber beinhält welche eingesetzt werden können.

[h1]Die Helden[/h1]
Es gibt gesamt 9 Helden welche allesamt ihre unterschiedlichen Stärken und Schwächen besitzen und ihre eigene Kampfweise haben. Vom Krieger über Magier und Zwergenkämpfer bis hin zu einem fliegenden Drachen ist für jeden etwas dabei.

[h1]Die Level[/h1]
Die Level sind sehr unterschiedlich getaltet. Es gibt zwar immer das Ziel die Feinde davon abzuhalten zu einem oder mehreren zielpunkten zu gelangen jedoch dabei sind unterschiedliche themen, Gimmicks und Bauweisen ringebaut worden. So hält man die Gegner in einem Level einfach nur auf von A nach B zu kommen, im nächsten Level gibt es dann 2 nicht verbundene Wege oder eine bestimmte Hütte in der man sonst nicht Baubare Einheiten Rekrutieren kann bis hin zu Gimmicks welche nicht Spielbeeinflussend sind wie einem Predator der in mehreren leveln versteckt ist, einem singenden Frosch oder einem Rätsel um einem Indiana Jones ähnlcihen helden aus einer Ruine zu helfen.

[h1]Die Türme[/h1]
Die Türme sind sehr abwechslungsreich gehalten, so gibt es anfangs zwar nur wenige Türme welche sich aber in späteren Upgrades sehr unterschiedlich aufsplten. So werden magiertürme zu licht oder Todestürmen, Bombentürme zu Presslufthamemrn oder Kampfrobotern und vieles mehr.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
- umfangreiches Upgrademenü 
- 9 helden
- Spiel lief absolut Fehlerfrei
- Viele Geheimnisse eingebaut
- Bosskämpfe
- mehrere Schwierigkeitsgrade
- 2 Zusätzliche Herausforderungsmodis für jedes Level
- Sehr gut balanced
- 41 verschiedene Gegnertypen die sich teils stark unterscheiden

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
- Viele Achievements
- Sammelkarten

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Leider nur 15 Level zur Zeit. 
- Manche Türme sind in den späteren leveln fast nutzlos und werden eigentlich kaum mehr verwendet

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Die Macher von kingdom Rush zeigen mal wieder das es bei Tower Defense Spielen nicht auf hochwertige 3D High Definition Grafik ankommt sondern eher darauf das das Spiel strategisch und weitreichend aufgebaut sein muss. Das Spiel ist einer der Beweise das Kingdom Rush kein One Hit Wonder war sondern es sogar teilweise noch evrbessert werden kann wenn man mit Liebe und Hingabe zum Spiel arbeitet.
Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung in jeder Hinsicht

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-

24520402.review:
(I got the game for free because I helped to Beta Test - that was nice of them!)

Second in the line of totally awsome Kingdom Rush TD games, Frontiers is a damn near total refinement and improvement of the original across the board!

The Hero system has been totally refined and expanded upon, no longer do heroes level to max in each battle and then lose their levels after you win. Now, heroes have persistent levels and abilities you can assign skill points to in whatever order you wish! Leveling heroes is fairly fast (especially when you play on later levels) so don't worry about there being a grind!

Level 4 Tower upgrades are all new and more interesting than in the original game! Now, the Mage towers can become the Necromancer or Archmage! Necromancer raises skeletons to block and fight for you when enemies die near the tower and the Archmage can store up to 3 high-damage shots to really blast enemies! Of course each level 4 Tower also has special abilities you can buy such as the Necromancer's Death Rider that is a powerful fighter and buffs nearby friendly skeletons and the Archmage can summon forth a Twister to damage and push back enemies!

All of the levels are top-grade stuff too with many having special features. One level has "Tuskan Raiders" up on a cliff shotting at targets that come near, another has man-eating plants that can gobble up friend and foe alike and yet another has a band of friendly dwarves (with unique Towers!) setup to aid you! These are only a few examples!

Truly great Tower Defense game and a worthy sequel to the first!

24518057.review:
Kingdom Rush无疑是有史以来最杰出的TD游戏之一。然而，Kingdom Rush Frontiers更是精彩、可圈可点。这部惊异之作所展示出的战略不仅仅局限于构建防御塔击败敌人之类的经典体系。它需要高度集中的注意力和精确的计划以达到胜利，而极为得体的可玩性则将漫长乏味的过程和乐趣的缺失（这二者恰是众多TD游戏的软肋）剔除在外。

Kingdom Rush最初只是个flash小游戏,在它大放异彩并在有限的圈子内受到普遍赞誉后,制作组Ironhide Game Studio便颇具野心地意欲将其在移动平台上推出。这个冒险的举措事后被证明是明智的,iOS平台上的Kingdom Rush甚至更受欢迎,此后该系列的重心便完全倾向于移动平台了。Kingdom Rush Frontiers于2013年6月6日在iOS平台上首发,2014年初Kingdom Rush登陆steam,同年11月Kingdom Rush Origins作为系列的第三部在iOS上推出。至此,Ironhide Game Studio凭借KR系列赚得盆满钵满,也开始想要拿出点什么回馈PC玩家了。但我在前面已经提到Kingdom Rush Frontiers是于3年前在iOS平台上首发的,现在steam上再卖一遍不就是坑钱吗?而事实上现在的steam版非但不是坑钱,反而能凸显Ironhide Game Studio的良心之处;原因我会在下文中详述。

社区页面的截图中已经展示出的优美重制画面和深具感染力的激昂音乐为此游戏增色不少,这些是有目共睹的;但上乘的画面和音乐没有喧宾夺主,反倒是通篇处于次要的陪衬地位,未丝毫影响到游戏本身令人沉迷的特性和精心设计的、耐人寻味的细节所带来欢乐,这更是难能可贵了。这款游戏的可玩性真的能令人沉溺其中,但我认为过多的详述反而会破坏那种无与伦比的爽快感或抬高跃跃欲试者的期望,所以对游戏本身的讨论就此打住。

至于价格,在与多样的内容的比较之下则显得过于低廉而几乎可以忽略不计了——尤其是考虑到这样一个事实,即:iOS版本上的所有额外内容在steam上都将被包含在免费的更新之中,而所有原本的付费内容——十二个英雄(根据可靠的说法全部购买将花费54美元左右)也将全部免费。这便是Ironhide Game Studio的良心之处了。一位开发者更是表示如果steam版销量好的话,将更新更多免费的额外内容,甚至有可能在steam上推出Kingdom Rush Origins!

对于这款Kingdom Rush Frontiers的最终评语,我认为赘述地再多也比不上一句“青出于蓝而胜于蓝”;再不济也得援引IGN编辑对于INSIDE所给出的评语并稍作改编:“Kingdom Rush Frontiers建立在使得Kingdom Rush如此杰出的东西之上,而且实际上建立了某些更加杰出的东西。”

12.10编辑

开发者刚刚在一个贴子里给出了中文和Update 1.4延期的理由:

http://steamcommunity.com/app/458710/discussions/0/154641879450362106/?ctp=6

Again, our apologies for the delay.

We are still correcting stuff in the translations. We asked members of the community to check a spreadsheet and suggest corrections.

There is such a massive language barrier between westerners and asians... you have no idea!
We hired a very good company to translate Frontiers... but we have no way of knowing if the translations are correct or not, because none of us speaks Korean, Japanese or Chinese.

And we don't want bad translations. We can't simply use Google Translate (as someone suggested in a previous post)... Google Translate doesn't take context and cultural innuendos into account. It's not just grammar, but semantics and syntaxes that must also be taken into account.

The final level for this update and the Heroes were ported with time to spare. But we couldn't account for the time needed to revise and correct errors in the translations. We are learning a lot from this.

我们再次为更新的延误道歉。

我们仍在校正翻译。我们请许多社区成员检查了一份电子表格、提出校订建议。

西方人和亚洲人间存在的语言障碍实在大到不可思议。
我们雇了一家不错的公司来翻译Frontiers...但我们无法得知翻译是否正确,因为我们这些人中没一个会说韩语、日语和汉语。

而且我们也不想得到质量很差的翻译。我们不能直接用Google翻译(有人在之前的贴子里提到这点)...Google翻译不能充分考虑到语境和文化暗喻。翻译不只是关乎语法,语意和句法也要被纳入考量。

这次更新的最终关和几个英雄的完工时间比预期要早。但这无法等同于修订和校正翻译错误所需的时间。我们从这件事中也学到了很多。
